Before you begin you must choose a character to follow who will have unique abilities and resources to help them earn the money needed to pay their debt. After each successful contract they will return to their home base and prepare for their next mission. Most of the money they earn goes straight into the vault but some can be used for recreational purposes. How much is saved and how much is spent is entirely up to the reader.

When a character has saved up enough money by doing missions the reader can then initiate the final phase of the story where they settle things with the people they owe money to. They can pay back the money and be on their way, double cross their boss and try run with the money or something else entirely. This is your story, only you can choose how it ends.

To select a character merely click on their name at the bottom of the page to read their profile. If you find someone you like you may then select a contract for them to begin. After that everything is entirely up to you. Listed below are some of the universal contacts all the mercenaries have access to as well as additional allies, enemies and other characters. Good luck!


Important Characters

The Patriot: A mysterious figure who can be contacted through a special website on the deep web. They represent the government you owe money to and are very eager to collect. If not kept in the loop on your progress and status they may send trouble your way but can also be a valuable ally if you need special government assistance on something. Of course, asking them for help will just add more to your debt...

Mr. Black: A world renowned arms dealer who has several dictators and politicians on his payroll. He is a friendly and jolly guy normally, but can be dangerous when angered. He can deliver and ship guns, ammo and other equipment all over the world quick and efficiently... for a price.

Daisy: A playful FBI agent and hacker who spends most of her free time playing MMOs and reading graphic novels. She helps keep your mercenary network safe and secure and protects it from going offline. She also helps set you up with contracts from members of the US government.

Ms. Ling: A wealthy woman who controls a large part of the criminal underground in China. She will buy and sell stolen and illegal items from anywhere at anytime no questions asked. She also offers plenty of black market goods that can't be bought anywhere else and even provides contracts from time to time.

Mr. Barlov: A mysterious Russian man with criminal connections all over the world. From the yakuza to the mafia he provides contracts to mercenaries all over the world and sets up meetings with all the right people to know in this line of work. He also has a side business of providing secretive transport and forged documents to help his contacts travel anywhere they need to be without worrying about border patrols or homeland security.

Sue: A young woman from Australia who is currently living somewhere in South America. She provides reliable vehicle shipment and repair work at cheap prices along with an assortment of mods both legal and illegal. She also sells weapon mods and can install guns, traps or other useful gadgets on whatever type of vehicle you might need.

Smith: A man who worked for years in criminal science and police work. He can remove evidence, provide cleaners to dispose of bodies, mislead the police... whatever you might need to get away with your illegal activities. He can even provide getaway drivers and distractions to help keep law enforcement off your back. He isn't a miracle worker though, and can't do much to protect you from serious crimes like political assassination or terrorism.

Mr. Weston: Lucy's loyal butler who is in charge of maintaining her base of operations while she is away. In addition to being skilled in various domestic areas such as cleaning, sewing, cooking and even gardening he is also highly trained in hand to hand combat and long distance marksmanship. He rarely gets his hands dirty, but many have made the fatal mistake of underestimating him as a harmless old man. He's rarely off the clock, but his two favorite hobbies are knitting and listening to classical music.

Ryu: Micheal's boss and the leader of the SGY. Not much is known about him other than the fact that he has a reputation as a fair and honorable man.

Daisuke: Micheal's main rival. Dai has been with the SGY for years before Micheal had even showed up and treats him with little respect despite the fact that they both share the same rank. Rude and arrogant he is fairly unpopular even among his henchmen and has few friends, preferring to use scare tactics and intimidation to get what he wants.

Sai: One of Micheal's yakuza buddies who often accompanies him when he hits the town. Sai is a bit mischievous and sneaky, but has proven his loyalty multiple times while working with Micheal.

Akira: A tall fat yakuza man with a stern and focused disposition. He is good friends with Micheal and Sai, but prefers to avoid partying and drinking as he see those activities as frivolous vices. Instead he focuses his time into helping his boss and making sure the SGY are staying productive and expanding their reach.

Mari: A young woman who Desmond developed a bit of a crush on when he met her in an online game a few years back. She provides him intel and occasionally sends him tech that she thinks he might have an interest in. Despite being pretty good friends neither she or Desmond have actually meet the other in real life.


Factions

Red Torch Mercenaries: The mercenary company you used to belong to before taking a government loan and setting out on your own. They have a high standard of morals as well as a strong reputation for getting the job done. If you have some spare cash they can be called in to help you on missions. They can also provide intel and a safe place to rest if you need it. Their bases can be found in nearly every major country. They have no official dress code but most of their members dress in red uniforms.

Green Leaf Mercenaries: A splinter faction that broke off from the Red Torch Mercenaries. They care less about collateral damage and discipline and only seem to be concerned about getting paid. They still have standards and will avoid taking unnecessary risks or causing avoidable damage, though they don't mind if things get messy. Many of them have a strong rivalry with Red Torch but will still work with them if they need to as long as they get compensated for their time. They have a strong army motif and many of their members dress like traditional soldiers.

Greed Demon Mercenaries: A small but very well equipped mercenary company that works with several world governments off the books. They have no morals and will do anything they are asked to as long as the cash is good. They have strong levels of discipline and punish failure harshly. They tend to have the most cutting edge gear and are infamous for committing atrocities and war crimes. While they mostly work with powerful countries during wars and rebellions they have no loyalty to any particular group and will gladly betray even their own employers for the right price. They are easily identified by their black and silver body armor and typically appear in three or six man groups on smaller jobs.

Global Police: The global police are a group of highly skilled soldiers and law enforcers from around the world. The group was created by the G.P.I. (Global Peace Initiative) to combat terrorism, corrupt dictators and all forms of international crime. They are extremely elite and the best at what they do. Their members are mostly comprised of former Army Rangers, FBI/CIA/KGB agents, Marines, SWAT commanders, reformed hackers and just about any and every other kind of badass you can think of. They tend to carry heavy weapons and armor and dress primarily in blue and gold uniforms. Specialist agents, such as combat engineers and explosives experts tend to wear white and gold instead.

Sakura Garden Yakuza: The yakuza group Micheal is currently working for. They own much of the criminal empire in and around Tokyo but still have a ways to go before they can compete with the bigger groups.

The Gun Club: A large network of elite soldiers who have retired from the army but not their work. The Gun Club is a freelance group of weapon enthusiasts who specialize in dealing with official army weapons, vehicles and gadgets. Due to the nature of their organization they often work outside the law, but try to avoid committing crimes whenever possible. Their main goal is to uphold the peace, keep america safe and provide support to veterans and wounded soldiers who desperately need it. Jeff Boone is a close associate of theirs and is on a first name basis with about half of their members.

11.content:
Name: Jeff Boone

Age: 52

Sex: Male

Race: Caucasian

Height: 6'1

Appearance: Jeff has short graying brown hair and a somewhat muscular build. He tries to stay in shape and typically dresses the part of a soldier when not relaxing at home. He is very fond of his fatigues and beret, but knows when to swap them out during the tough jobs in exchange for body armor and a helmet. He is often clean shaven but is fond of growing a small mustache or even full beard from time to time. He has amber eyes that he tends to hide behind sunglases or goggles when on duty.

Home Base: L.A. Apartment. This luxury apartment is big and spacious but also discreet and with a lot of security patrolling 24/7. It comes stocked with a full kitchen, living room, bed room, bathroom and even an outdoor balcony. Despite it being high class it has very little furniture and decorations as Jeff lives alone and mostly just uses it as a giant storage closet and trophy room. Aside from a few tables, chairs and a mini-bar the living room is stacked with boxes and a large wall safe locked by a security pass code. One of the few luxuries Jeff allows himself is a small game corner complete with a pool table, pinball machine and a fancy poker set.

Skills/Perks: Jeff has served in the army for over 20 years and has retained many close friends in very high positions throughout the years. This allows him to call in emergency aid or support whenever he needs it and provides him with access to military grade equipment that other people struggle to obtain. His combat training makes him deadly both in close range and at a distance and gives him the skills to use any type of weapon effectively. He also has the knowledge required to pilot helicopters, tanks and other types of military vehicles.

Weaknesses: His age has slightly dulled his senses and agility, which means he tends to react a little slower and tire out a little quicker than the other mercenaries. He also has a bit of a drinking problem and isn't at his best unless he has a little alcohol in his system.

Starting Assets: Several military firearms such as assault rifles and automatic shotguns as well as a few pistols. A crate of ammo for each of his guns. Military grade body armor. An RPG with a dozen rounds. A private helicopter docked at a nearby airfield that is equipped with both turret and missile defenses. A jeep in his garage stocked with supplies such as MREs, canteens and an extra tank of fuel. A two way field radio to keep in contact with fire support.

Starting Contracts

Missing In Action - An old army buddy of Jeff's has recently disappeared from his home town in New Mexico without a trace. The man's wife and sons think a local biker gang may be behind it but are not sure. To complete this mission Jeff will need to head to his buddies house to gather clues and intel and hopefully find his friend. This contract poses unknown risks and unknown rewards. Pay: $1,000,000- $25,000,000

The Wall - A mexican drug cartel has recently run into trouble with border security and needs help transporting their crew across the border. In addition to drugs and guns the cartel has several customers that have paid for transport and need to get them safely to their destination. The main priority is the safety of the customers, but the cartel will pay extra for any guns and drugs that survive the trip. In addition to border security and the DEA Jeff may need to contend with local police or even rival cartels seeking to undermine their rivals. The job has a lot of risks, but high rewards for a job well done. Pay: $50,000,000 - $125,000,000

Car Collection - A big shipment of imported luxury cars has arrived at a large dealership in downtown L.A. and several have caught Mr. Barlov's eye. If Jeff can gather a crew to boost some of the rides he can expect a large payday. This job poses moderate risks and rewards depending on the number and state of the cars delivered. Going alone reduces the risks, but getting all of the cars will require a team. Pay: $1,000,000 - $20,000,000

Hellfire And Ash - A mafia group in New York city have recently acquired a large supply of experimental incendiary ammunition and are terrorizing the criminal underground with it. Desperate times call for desperate measures so several big criminal groups have pulled together a bounty for anyone who can stop them and put an end to their reign for good. This job will be extremely dangerous and will require careful planning and tactics. Brute force may work, but opens lots of potential for retaliation by the mob's enforcers. To complete the job all of the experimental ammo must be taken or destroyed without the mafia being able to trace who is responsible. Major risks and rewards for this one, maybe even a new way to start up a BBQ. Pay: $10,000,000 - $50,000,000

Ice Storm - A large blizzard has hit a crew of drug runners up near the canadian border, grounding their escape chopper and forcing them to flee from the police. Luckily, they were able to reach an isolated ski resort in the mountains and are currently engaged in a standoff with the cops that has lasted several hours. To complete this contract Jeff needs to secure as much of their coke as possible and make sure that the drug runners escape the police. Things will almost certainly get messy so plan ahead and be careful how you go about this. Pay: $100,000,000 - $125,000,000
11.title: The Commando

111.content:
You took a long drag off of your cigar as your jeep pulled into Eden Springs, a quaint little town in the middle of nowhere with a population just over 1000. It was a nice enough place for a pitstop along the highway, it had a large general store, a bowling alley and, most importantly, a local watering hole called Vulture's Rest. You blow a ring of smoke as you point your driver down a road leading to a long row of houses with wooden fences.

It looked like a good neighborhood, kids were playing in yards as the sun began setting on the western horizon and some of the adults were enjoying beers and cook outs, but looks could be deceiving... as you had learned during your long tour of military service. "Up here, pull up to the driveway with the blue pickup out front." you say as a familiar house came into view. Your driver nodded wordlessly and pulled over to the sidewalk.

"Get some gas and pick up a snack if you want, I'll probably be done in an hour or so. Be back in 45 minutes or less, alright?" you request as you open the door and began walking up the driveway. "Will do, Jeff. I'll see you in 40, man." the driver called back as he pulled out and disappeared around the corner. You stub out your cigar and put it away to finish later before removing your sunglasses and ringing the doorbell.

Barely a few seconds passed before a mousy young woman with long blonde hair and a floral print skirt stepped out to greet you. "Oh Jeff, thank god you're here. I think something terrible has happened." she said in a shaky voice, clearly on the verge of a breakdown. You merely nodded and asked to come in. "Of course, please have a seat in the living room." she replied with an attempted smile as she opened the door for you.

"Thank you, Sera. I'll do what I can to find Hank, our squad owes him that much for all he's done for us. I've already radioed the boys, they'll all be here by tomorrow." you promise as you take a seat on a leather couch next to a beautiful aquarium. After sending her two young sons into their room to play Sera joined you on the opposite side of the tiny coffee table. "Would you like a beer Jeff? I think my husband got a fresh six pack before he went missing last week."

"No thank you, Sera." you reply quickly, noticing the struggle it took to mention her husband. "I'd prefer to be sober for this. Now before I can get started I need to ask you some questions, alright?" Sera merely nodded her head as she grabbed a tissue off of the arm of the chair she was sitting in and blew her nose. "Of course, ask away. I'll do whatever I can to help."

You thought for a moment and then began your investigation with the first question.
111.title: The Investigation Begins

1111.content:
Sera frowned for a moment as she tried to recall the exact day her husband went missing. "Here, right at the doorway. He had just got back from his job and left to pick up a friend of his for a night of drinking and partying. They were going to watch a movie at the new theater about 20 miles up the road after getting a few drinks at Vultures's Rest. I expected him to be gone for most of the night, but when he didn't come back the day after I started to worry."

You frown as you memorized the addresses and directions Sera gave you. "Not much to go on, but I can work with this." you note as you withdraw a tiny notebook from your pocket and write a few things down. "Can you give me any details that people might recognize? His license plate number, their clothes, the model of vehicle they were driving, things like that?" Sera thought for a few seconds as she desperately tried to remember everything she could. "I don't remember much, but I do recall a few things."

"Both of them were clean shaven and were wearing jackets. Hank had his black cowboy hat on, the one with the tiny tear near the back. I didn't see what they left in, but I think Robert was driving his sportscar, the new blue one he got a few months back. I don't know the model or license plate, but it has these bright green flames painted on both sides. It should be easy to identify." she continued as you took more notes. The picture was starting to come together a little now.

"Okay, this really helps, can you tell me what time they left? Try to be as exact as possible." you ask as you write down some addresses of local car mechanics and auto shops in the area you had looked up before arriving. "I've got a pretty good idea of how we can identify where they went, I just need a good time frame and I can get started." Sera rubbed her head as she tried desperately to recall when she last saw her husbands smiling face.

"It was fairly late, probably before nine but after seven. I was in the middle of watching a show, so it was likely about seven or eight thirty. Oh god, I wish I could remember more... I should be able to remember more." she said as a few fresh tears formed in her eyes. You took a moment to calm her down and finished writing the last few clues she could give you. After looking over your notes to make sure everything was right you asked Sera to double check everything she had given you. It was all accurate.

"Okay, I think I can get the ball rolling now. Thank you Sera, I'll do everything I can to find Hank." you say with a smile as you pocket the notebook and stand up. "Now that that's done I'll have a beer or two if you don't mind. You might want to have one yourself. It'll help with the stress a bit." She nodded and headed over to the kitchen to grab the drinks from the fridge while you checked in with your driver. After about twenty minutes of talking a jeep pulled up in the driveway outside and honked its horn once to signify its arrival.

"That's my ride, I'll see you when I have an update. Take care of yourself Sera." you say as you crush your empty beer can and toss it into the nearby trashcan. "Thank you Jeff, be careful out there." Sera called from the kitchen as you stepped outside into the cool evening air and waved goodbye from the door way. In less than five minutes you'd be back on the road heading to your first stop...
1111.title: Picking Up The Trail

11111.content:
"Vulture's rest, eh? I passed that place on my way to get gas." your driver mused as he turned out of the suburbs and headed towards the commerce area of the town. "It didn't look half bad, but a few of the locals I met at the station called it a shithole. Let's watch ourselves once we get inside." You nodded and lit your cigar back up. "Shithole or not, someone there probably saw something. Plus I can grab a drink while we're there, I could use a nice Old Fashioned or Tequila Sunrise right about now."

Your driver pulled into the parking lot of a crowded two-story building just off the freeway. It had a bright neon sign out front and about two dozen other cars jammed together near the front sidewalk. "I think this is the place." your driver said aloud as he stuffed his bowie knife into a holster on the inside of his jacket. "What tipped you off, Hal?" you snark back as you exhale a cloud of smoke. "The bright lights, the big neon sign or the air of civility and intellectualism?"

Hal rolled his eyes as he lit up a smoke and dug his wallet out of his pocket. "I take it drinks are on you tonight? I've only got about fifty bucks left, that damn gas was about five bucks a gallon." You laugh and pull a few hundred dollar bills out of your pocket. "Yeah, yeah. I still owe you for that bet you won about the IED anyway, two hundred I believe?" you reply as you hand him the cash. He grins as he remembers how he almost got his arm blown off. "Oh yeah, wasn't that bet five hundred though?"

You sigh as you finish off your cigar and toss the stub into a nearby trashcan. "Don't push your luck... and don't forget why we're here. Hank saved our asses more than once, let's concentrate on finding him before we start worrying about old scores." Hal's expression turns serious as he nods and takes a long drag off his cigarette. "Alright Jeff, you're calling the shots tonight so I'll follow your lead. Let's get Hank back to his wife and kids."

You give him as smile as you both head inside. "That's what I like to hear soldier. Now let's do this."
11111.title: The Local Flavor

choices: Play it safe for now and ignore the book
Try to find a quick record of your buddy while the bartender is distracted
Swipe the book before the bartender returns
111112.content:
The interior of the place was pretty nice all things considered. There were about a dozen wooden tables in front of a large counter lined with various white collar workers waiting on drinks after a long day. Off to your left was a side room stocked with a couple pool tables, a jukebox and dart boards. To the right was a small dining area where a few folks were enjoying meals before heading to their night shifts or a long drive home. It was pleasant, but made you feel a bit uneasy. There were definitely a few shady things that went on here each night...

"Stick close, let me do most of the talking." you whisper to your partner as you walk past the tables up to the bar. "Gotcha, I'll follow your lead." Hal whispers back as you grab two empty seats at the end of the counter near a man who was either passed out drunk or trying to catch up on a few hours of missed sleep. A few slow minutes passed as the bartender served a few beers to the other patrons before noticing the two of you sitting alone.

"Evening boys." she says in a sultry voice as she walks over. "What can I get y'all this evening?" She seemed nice enough but you figured it was best to be careful with your words. If she had any information on Hank she might not be willing to give it up so easily. "I'll take a Tequila Sunrise." you reply as you place a few bills on the table. "Just a cold coke for me, I'm the driver." Hal quickly added. The bartender smiled and walked off to get your orders as you and Hal discussed what your next move should be.

"Think she knows anything about Hank?" you ask in a hushed tone. Hal nodded his head as he lit up a cigarette. "No doubt, they must have passed through here. I heard from one of the guys at the gas station that she works the late shift here each night, if anyone here saw something it'd have to be her." You frown as you rub your chin. "I think your right, this place made my skin crawl ever since we walked in. Something isn't right here... that's for damn sure."

You continue talking as the bartender delivers your drinks and gives you another warm smile. "Anything else y'all need you just let me know, okay?" You are about to speak up when a drunken man near one of the pool tables gets into an argument with a biker and throws one of the pool cues at him. The biker then retaliates by kicking him to the ground as his buddies egg him on. "Oh shit, not again..." the bartender mutters under her breath as she heads over to break up the fight. "That's enough of that! Hey, I said stop it you two!"

Hal takes a sip out of his coke and gestures over to the back shelf of the bar with his eyes. You take a moment to look over and notice an unattended record book the bartender must have forgotten to put away. With everyone distracted with the fight you could easily swipe it and maybe find a record of your friend's visit... or get thrown out on your ass if the bartender catches you reading it. You take a quick sip out of your drink and decide to...
111112.title: Vulture's Rest

choices: Go to confront her while Hal guards the stairs
Have a look around while Hal keeps an eye out for her
Head into the living room and wait patiently for her to return
1111121.content:
No point to taking unnecessary risks and causing a scene if you can avoid it, especially with your friend's life on the line. You take a long sip of your drink as the bartender slaps one of the men across the face then throws both men out with the help of a burly man you took to be a security guard of some type. After a few seconds of tense silence everyone moved back to their own drinks and food like nothing had happened.

When you feel things have calmed down enough you gesture for the bartender to come over to your table again. "Sorry about that folks, we get trouble occasionally from a local biker gang. I swear, those assholes think they own this town sometimes. Anyway, what can I get y'all now?" she asks sweetly as you finish off the last of your drink. "I think I'll just have one more Tequila Sunrise and call it a night. Say, what time do you get off work?"

"Not til' tomorrow morning, I work the night shift after all." she replies in a flirty tone. "Why? You asking me out on a date, handsome?" You laugh as you pull out a few hundred dollar bills and give them to her as a tip. "Not quite, ma'am. Me and my buddy are just in town seeing a friend and we could a tour guide is all... who better than a local? Especially one that's so easy on the eyes..."

The bartender chuckles softly as she puts her hands on her hips. "You willing to wait another several hours for my shift to end or were you asking me to head out with you now?" You shrug your shoulders as Hal gives her a smile while sipping on his coke. "We just got back from deployment, I think we can wait for you for a couple more hours." you reply.

The bartender smiles as she looks you both over. Hal wasn't much of a looker, but you were still in pretty good shape for someone rapidly approaching old age. "A couple of soldiers, huh? Alright, I guess I can take a night off. Let me just go tell the boss to ring up my replacement and I'll be right back with your drink." With that she disappears behind the counter and heads into a back room to talk with her boss. After about five minutes she was walking over to your table with your Tequila Sunrise, now dressed in jeans and a t-shirt.

"I'm ready to head out when you two are, I know a few great places to party in this little one horse town of ours." she replies as she leans in to give you a kiss on the cheek. "We can leave here in a few just as soon as me and my buddy Hal finish our drinks, I'm Jeff by the way. Nice to meet you." you say with another smile. The bartender giggles. "I'm Cynthia, good to meet ya Jeff."

You chat her up for a few minutes as Hal tells a few dirty jokes before the three of you head back out to the parking lot. You follow Cynthia back to her car as Hal heads over to get the jeep. The plan for tonight was to head back to Cynthia's place for a few minutes while she changed clothes and then decide where to go from there. Unbeknownst to her, you had more on your mind than just a night of partying and fun however. She definitely knew something, you just needed to get her to talk...

After a short drive you pull into the long driveway of a modest two story house about a mile out of town and step out into the cool night air once again. Hal was coming up the driveway behind you as you walked Cynthia over to the door and went inside. "Head into the kitchen and help yourself to anything you want inside the fridge, I'll be back down in a minute." she whispers in your ear as she begins heading up the stairs. Hal walks through the door just as she disappears upstairs. Time to make your move.
1111121.title: The Night Is Still Young...

choices: Play up the role of a junkie for now
Try to change the subject and get her to drop her guard
Confront her and threaten to have her arrested
11111213.content:
You gesture for Hal to follow you into the adjacent living room and take a seat on a large sofa as Hal sits down in a recliner across from you. The room was pretty small but quite comfy with a sort of rustic charm to it. Behind Hal was a large bookshelf stacked with everything from cooking and gardening books to old family photos and a few small potted plants. Aside from a small lamp the only light came from a full moon bleeding through the curtains covering a large window on the far wall.

"This is a pretty nice house for a waitress." Hal wonders aloud as he stares out the window at the lonely stretch of darkened terrain surrounding the house. "Maybe this house has been in the family a while." he adds as he looks over at a tiny coffee table next to the window that had a big group photo of a large family on it. "Could be." you reply as you grab a hunting magazine from the end table next to the sofa and give it a quick skim. "Just keep your guard up and remember why we're here. Let me do the talking."

After about five minutes of quiet silence Cynthia walks back down the stairs carrying a small briefcase and wearing nothing but a bathrobe. "Hey there, gentlemen." she cooed softly. "Sorry to keep y'all waiting but I decided to freshen up a bit and have a shower." You give her a quick look over to make sure she isn't hiding any concealed weapons as she took a seat in the remaining chair and opened the brief case on the small coffee table in front of the window.

Inside was a wide assortment of strange and colorful substances in bottles, bags and vials of all shapes and sizes. You could easily make out what looked like some common street drugs like cocaine and marijuana, but most of it wasn't immediately identifiable. "Normally, I only accept appointments on the deals I make but since you two party animals just rolled into town I'll go ahead and lay it all out on the table for ya." she says with a mischievous grin.

You aren't sure quite how it happened but your new girlfriend here apparently mistook you and Hal for a couple of druggies looking for something to take the edge off. It made sense, of course, there probably wasn't much else to do in this one horse town beyond getting high, though her boldness was definitely a surprise. Hal shoots you a quick "What do you wanna do?" look while Cynthia has her back turned to him.

"Well boys, what'll you be having this evening? I can offer ya a discount on half this shit, just let me know what you're in the mood for." Cynthia offers as she begins removing a few of her top sellers out of the case and begins placing them on the table. You give her a fake interested smile as you think over your options.
11111213.title: Let's Make A Deal

choices: Threaten her
Try to bribe her
Leave her for now
111112131.content:
"Well now, I see you got quite a selection there honey, I feel like a kid in a candy store. Where'd you get all this product anyway?" you ask in a curious tone. Cynthia grins as she leans forward and exposes her cleavage a little as she puts a hand on her hip. "Hey now, you boys should know I can't just give away any information like that. If ya want to buy in bulk I'll have to okay it with my supplier first. Otherwise I'm afraid y'all will have to make do with what I got."

You give her a perverted grin as you pretend to look over the drugs she had scattered over the table. "Let's see now, I've had LSD, ecstasy, opium... hell, even a little crystal meth... but I don't even recognize half this stuff you got on the table, Mind filling in a few blanks for us so we can get to know the product a little better?" you inquire with the same politely curious tone as before. She seems to be buying your act hook, line and sinker.

"Oh, a real party animal, huh darling?" she replies with a laugh. "Let's see, I've got uppers, downers, stimulants of all kinds, performance enhancers, pain meds, relaxants, sedatives, hallucinogenics... just about anything you need. If you've got the cash I've also got a few samples of some high quality designer chemicals that might be what you're looking for. What's your current price range?"

You pause for a minute as you pretend to think. "Uh, lets see here. Well, to be perfectly honest money isn't an issue... we just thought we'd grab something for our buddy from the service. He likes all kinds of shit but he's got a few very specific tastes. Come to think of it we expected to meet up with him in town but haven't been able to get in touch with him yet. Maybe you can help us, a local said they saw him visit your bar a few nights back..."

Cynthia frowns a bit as she looks you over, seemingly searching for a hint of dishonesty. "Uh, a lot of guys come by there. Was he an army type like yourselves?" she asks in a somewhat nervous tone. You take a deep breath as you consider your next words carefully. "Yeah, he was with his friend, drove a real fancy car. Bunch of flames painted on the side. Hang on, I can check the make and model for you."

You pull out a piece of paper with notes on the car and put it onto the table along with a hundred dollar bill. "We'd like to find him soon. If he had a bad trip and hurt himself he might need our help... does any of that information ring a bell?" Cynthia bit her lip as she read the note and began to grow a shade or two paler. "Yeah... yeah, I know this guy." she finally answers as she puts the note down and gives you a concerned look.

"I remember your friend and his buddy arriving the other night. One of the two got drunk and started a fight with a couple members of the local biker gang. Real mean sons o' bitches. I had to throw them all out but I heard them arguing out in the parking lot. After a few minutes I also heard some breaking glass and some sort of loud thumping so I called the police. By the time they showed up all of the men were gone." she replied in a hushed tone, seemingly afraid to speak about the biker gang out loud.

"Now we're getting somewhere." Hal piped up as he leaned in closer. "Do you know who these guys are?" A deathly silence fell over the entire room for a few seconds as Cynthia put both her hands on her knees. It looked like she was struggling to say something but no words came out. "I'm sorry, but I can't say anything else..." she finally replied with a weary sigh. You and Hal both exchange looks before turning your attention back to Cynthia...
111112131.title: The Other Night

choices: Go solo
Hire a crew to help you
Hire a crew and some specialists
113.content:
You sipped on a fresh whiskey sour as you lounged in your hot tub and watched the sunset from the balcony of your apartment. You were just about to light up a cigar when your phone rang from the nearby table, forcing you to get out of the warm water into the cool night air. "Every single time I try to relax, without fail..." you mutter to yourself as you grab a towel and drape it over your shoulders. "I hope this is at least something important."

With a click a deep voiced Russian man with a thick accent greeted you on the other side of the line. "Hello my friend, I hope I am not interrupting anything?" You sigh as you take a sip out of your drink and sit the glass down on the table. "No, no, I was just about to grab a quick soak in the hot tub and relax a bit. If this is work related, let me have the details and I'll get back to you with my answer."

"That sounds good, my friend. I'll have the contract sent to your private inbox, please enjoy the rest of your evening." came the reply as the man gave a quick laugh and wrote something down on his notepad. "Of course Mr. Barlov, thank you for considering me. You have yourself a nice night." you reply as you hang up and walk back over to the hot tub. After about an hour you finish up your last cigar, get dressed and boot up your laptop. Sure enough, a new contract was waiting for you when you logged in.

Apparently, a shipment of rare and expensive cars was being delivered to a secret warehouse tomorrow evening on the far side of L.A. for an upcoming car show. Whoever footed the bill for these beauties clearly didn't skimp on getting them delivered, all of the vehicles had been shipped first class with extreme care given by their handlers to make sure none were lost or damaged. The list of special modifications made to several of the cars boosted their value even further... you wondered if some of these changes were even legal in this state.

"Barlov's not offering much, but a simple job like this'll help get me back into the swing of things. I've been taking it easy a bit too much while I wait for jobs to come in." you say to yourself as you send your employer a confirmation email and go over the details of the job. This wouldn't be too hard to do by yourself, but there was no way you'd be able to retrieve all of the cars even if you used stealth. To get them all you'd need a proper crew... all of whom would expect a sizable chunk of the profits.

Another factor to consider was security, judging by all of the expenses paid to keep these cars off the radar and safe it was a good bet that their owners would be pulling out all the stops to protect them. Locks, keycards, cameras, security patrols... who knows what you'd have to get past. Calling in some specialists might help in this area as well, but they'd all want to be paid too. You could either take some big risks and hope they pay off or do things the smart yet expensive way.

How do you want to do it?
113.title: The Shipment

choices: Announce your arrival to draw out the targets
Keep your identity secret for the time being
Assemble a crew to accompany you
114.content:
You exhaled a wisp of smoke after taking a long drag off your cigar and popped the cap off a fresh beer straight from the cooler. The sun was setting on the distant horizon and you were glad to enjoy some downtime before you headed out for your next big mission. A cool breeze blew across the balcony as you opened your laptop and brought up your contract database on the dark web. There was a lot of shady shit that went on there, but it provided discretion and plentiful clients in need of an experienced combat veteran like yourself.

You checked your inbox and scrolled down the list of potential contracts. Some jobs were too dirty for you to consider and others just didn't offer the cash you needed. The hardest part of finding a new job was always balancing time investment with worthwhile payment. Lots of people offered millions to keep their dirty secrets from surfacing, but that mattered little when doing a cover up required weeks of planning, bribing and searching. You always preferred the simpler jobs... shoot some guys, steal some stuff... blow up a building or two... all of this spy and espionage horseshit got on your nerves.

While deleting a message from some guy who wanted your help shooting up a government building you came across an email from an unidentified agent asking for help with some kind of experimental new ammo. Interested at the prospect of discovering a practical new type of ammunition you immediately clicked the open tab and read over the contract. The pay was good and you would be allowed to keep some of the goodies for yourself once the job was over... the only catch was that this would be a tougher mission to complete.

With the mafia involved and god knows how many underworld criminals things were sure to get messy at some point. While you were never a man to back away from a challenge you were getting a bit older and had to take care that you didn't step into something you'd have trouble finishing. In the end, though, the lure of prototype incendiary rounds was too great a prize to ignore and you sent a quick reply to get some more details.

After squaring everything away you closed your laptop and headed back inside once you finished your cigar and beer and booked a flight for New York. Tomorrow you'd fly out to the Big Apple itself on one of the most thrilling jobs of your life, but for now you had to come up with a plan. This wasn't a job for rookies and while you were confident in your abilities experience told you to always have a plan of action, especially an exit strategy in chase the shit hit the fan.

After an hour sitting at your kitchen table with a fresh glass of orange juice you headed off to bed confident that you were ready for anything. The question is, what kind of strategy did you go with?
114.title: Time To Fire It Up!

choices: A local arms dealer's apartment
The hotel you planned to stay at
The house of an informant with info on the experimental ammo
1143.content:
Before heading out to the airport you got in touch with some old army buddies and explained the details of the job to them, unfortunately most were busy with other stuff or uninterested, though a few agreed to meet up once you landed in New York. After deciding on a hotel to stay at you say goodbye to the boys and head out to catch your plane. Soon you were soaring out of the west coast and heading for the east coast on a first class flight.

Not much happened on the way to your destination, a few passengers got mad at the flight attendants and a couple were caught having sex in the bathroom, minor stuff that didn't interest you. As your plane pulled into the airport you looked out the window at the sprawling city in front of you. It had been a while since your last visit but you remembered what it was like, pretty and exciting on the outside, nasty and dangerous on the inside.

After picking up your luggage you headed out to grab a cab and get on with your job. As much as you wanted to go sight-seeing you knew that it would have to wait until you got done with work first. Business before pleasure, after all. As a cab driver pulls over to greet you upon exiting the terminal you walk up to the window and toss him a clip of bills worth $5000. "I'm in a bit of a hurry, I need to get to the following address as soon as possible." you whisper as you climb into the back and toss your luggage on the seat.

"Y-Yes sir! Of course, sir!" the stunned man behind the wheel exclaims as he pockets the cash and speeds out of the airport. In just under twenty minutes you arrived at your destination...
1143.title: Welcome To The Big City

choices: Quickly sneak in through the front
Go around and sneak in through the back
Go in loud to provide a distraction so that the drug runners can escape
115.content:
You finished off the last of your second beer as you did one final check up to make sure you were ready for the drop off. You were currently cruising at a smooth altitude of around 10,000 feet over a sea of treetops as your pilot buddy headed for your destination. The job had come in at the last minute from a powerful drug kingpin who stood to lose a whole shipment of his product and some of his best runners if someone didn't arrive to bail their asses out of their predicament soon.

Luckily, you were just close enough that a quick trip up north gave you a good chance of salvaging the situation, though it wouldn't be an easy job with all the cops around. In addition to a suit of proper combat armor and your best rifle you had brought along some flares, a canteen of water, your prized bowie knife and a silenced pistol, along with a few other emergency supplies like matches and a radio. You also brought a stun gun and cable ties in case you needed to go the nonlethal route.

"Hey Jeff, I put out the call to our contact with the cops, he'll keep em' distracted on the ski resort while I drop you off about a mile or two away near the road." a loud voice said over the loudspeaker. "Be ready to jump in five minutes, we'll only get one shot at this." As the voice shut off you equipped your parachute and backpack and headed over to the rear of the plane as the pilot slowed his descent over the trees.

After a few minutes the hatch opened up, letting in a flurry of snowflakes as you prepared for the jump. The bright lights of the ski lodge cut through the inky black sky and pointed treetops like a knife surrounded by the glittering flicker of blue and red lights. "Go ahead and aim for the hill up ahead, those boys likely won't be able to hold out for too much longer. Good luck out there!" the pilot announced as you made the leap and soared towards the abandoned ranger outpost sitting at the top of a nearby hillside.

With a quick flick of the wrist you unleashed your parachute and drifted softly towards your target. The lights of the ski resort slowly faded from sight as you brushed past a tall pine tree and landed firmly on solid ground. After taking a moment to reorient yourself you pushed past some snow covered bushes and began climbing the rickety wooden stairs of the long forgotten ranger outpost. When you got to the top you then pulled out a pair of binoculars and walked over to the flimsy railing and tried to get a good look at the resort.

It was hard to make out any human figures, but the front of the parking lot was swarming with police cars and SWAT vans, not a good sign. "Let's hope by the time I get there I find something worth saving." you whisper as your breath chilled to fog in front of you. After scoping out the layout of the building you took a few minutes to come up with a plan of action that could effectively deal with the situation.
115.title: Snowy Landing

choices: Head for the SWAT van
Head for the stone planters
Head around through the woods
1152.content:
With the area properly scoped out you headed back down the creaking stairs to the snowy ground below. This blizzard would probably last for several more hours, at least, so any form of air travel was probably out of the question. At some point you would have to figure out an alternate method of escape, which wouldn't be easy given your severely limited resources. Oh well, that was a problem for later, right now you were only concerned about getting inside to fully assess the situation.

As you carefully made your way through the snowy forest you made sure to make as little noise as possible. Luckily, it was late and most animals had taken shelter from the hostile weather. As the lights of the police cars became visible again through the dense snowy foliage you slowed your pace a bit and drew your knife and stun gun. You didn't like the idea of having a big shootout with the cops and drawing attention, but at least now you'd be ready.

A large SWAT van was parked near the far edge of the parking lot and would provide some good cover, but there were a few agents talking nearby while looking off towards the woods. They must be guards, keeping an eye out for any members of the gang that ran off and decided to come back. They were looking away from you but could turn around at any moment and it was a good ten or twenty feet between the cover of the SWAT van and the nearest bush. Quite a risky way to go.

Hoping for more options you looked around at the cops and law enforcement agents keeping their eyes peeled on the building. No shooting had broken out yet, but that could change in a second, especially if you didn't hurry. The original plan was to sneak around back to avoid most of the assault crew, though it would be pretty tricky to accomplish that task if you couldn't find any safe avenues of infiltration.

There were a few thick bushes and elevated stone planters lining the parking lot, but a few other guards were patrolling them. Still pretty dangerous, one wrong turn and a fight could break out... and you weren't properly prepared for a fight on this scale, not even close. "There must be a safer way around." you whisper under your breath as you look at the woods surrounding the rest of the ski resort. It was probably too thick to sneak through quietly, but it could be the quickest option.

You take a deep breath and make your move...
1152.title: Out In The Cold...

choices: Lunch Money
Blood Diamonds
Off The Rails
420 Degrees
Just Plane Wrong
12.content:
Name: Lucy Red

Age: 27

Sex: Female

Race: Mixed (75% Caucasian / 25% Hispanic)

Height: 5'9

Appearance: A natural beauty with flowing dark brown hair, tan skin and emerald green eyes. Lucy loves wearing anything elegant and stylish, but has a particular fondness for red or black dresses. Always a tease she especially enjoys outfits that expose her ample cleavage and accentuate her butt and legs. She usually doesn't wear anything on her head, but ribbons and scarves are not unheard of. She also prefers to wear light makeup, usually just a bit of red lipstick and some nail polish.

Home Base: Mansion. A small mansion located just outside Paris, France. It isn't very large, but is equipped with just about every luxury you can think of including a spa, bathhouse, twelve bedrooms, a wine cellar and a large garden out front. The mansion also has a few secret rooms accessible only with a keycard such as a firing range, armory, panic room and vault. There are also many hidden traps and security measures that can be activated with hidden switches and levers. Lastly, the whole facility is staffed with highly paid and well trusted butlers, maids and chefs.

Skills/Perks: Lucy is well known for her beauty and isn't afraid to use it to her advantage, but what makes her truly deadly is her silver tongue and keen intellect. She can speak fluent english, french, spanish, japanese, chinese and russian along with knowing several words in many other languages. She also has training with knives, lockpicking, small firearms (such as handguns, machine pistols and revolvers) and poisons. She knows basic first aid and can make antidotes as well.

Weaknesses: Physically, Lucy is very weak and only has a basic grasp of martial arts, which forces her to rely on subversive or indirect means of eliminating her foes. She can handle herself pretty well in a firefight, but can be overwhelmed by large numbers of powerful opponents. She also prefers to work alone, which means she doesn't get along well with others and shuns teamwork. She may even abandon her comrades if things get too intense.

Starting Assets: A large assortment of pistols and handguns, many of which are engraved in silver or gold. A few light machine guns. Ammo for all of her weapons. A massive collection of knives and various chemicals and lab equipment. A massive wardrobe filled with all manner of clothes for any situation, be it gunfights on a mountain top or a cocktail party downtown. Several flak jackets and some specially designed flameproof dresses.

Starting Contracts

Lunch Money - An underground counterfeiting operation has been discovered by the local authorities and always manages to give the cops the slip before they can be captured. The government suspects that someone in the group is paying off officials to stay one step ahead of the police and has decided to put out a discreet contract on the group. The job is simple, stop the counterfeiting and either kill or capture the crooks before they escape. Bringing the criminals in alive pays more however. Moderate risk is involved. Pay: $1,000,000 - $75,000,000

Blood Diamonds - A meeting between an african warlord and a crooked american businessman is set to go down in a motel outside of paris involving blood diamonds. The person who posted this contract doesn't have any info on security so expect anything and everything. The mission will be considered complete once both of the men and their associates are dead. In addition to the contract pay the merc who completes the assignment is entitled to any blood diamonds they can recover. Pay: $10,000,000 - $15,000,000

Off The Rails - A train transporting a world renowned musician and their entourage is scheduled to make a stop in paris on their most recent tour. To do this one Lucy will need to find a way to board the train before it arrives at its destination and hold it up. Having a crew and a way to transport stolen goods would be useful here, but it can be done solo for less loot. Aside from some body guards security should be pretty standard, making this a fairly low risk job. Pay: $20,000,000 - $100,000,000

420 Degrees - A local pot farmer has set up what she thinks will grow into a major operation in the downtown district. In an abandoned warehouse and nearby hotel she has set up a massive weed garden staffed by guards and growers. The place has started to bring in some serious cash and the other drug dealers are having trouble keeping up with her prices. All you have to do is stop by a locker on the way to the garden which will be stocked with goodies to help you burn down this little farm. Upon completion of the job you will be sent you pay and may keep anything you acquire from the locker. Risk level is moderate. Pay: $1,000,000 - $5,000,000

Just Plane Wrong - An ultra high tech fighter plane is being developed by the french military and a prototype model is scheduled for a test run at a local airport. This mission is pretty standard, protect and escort two pilots to the plane so that they can hijack it for their boss. It doesn't matter if things go loud or you complete the whole job unnoticed so long as the pilots get away with the aircraft. Expect heavily security and tons of resistance if you are found. Needless to say, this one is pretty dangerous but also highly rewarding if you can get the job done. Pay: $100,000,000 - $150,000,000
12.title: The Bloody Valentine

choices: You go the stealth route with a silenced weapon
You go the commando route with a big gun
You go the versatile route with two good situational weapons
121.content:
You looked over the scope on a modified SMG and checked the clip before putting it back in its case. You had spent the last two hours overlooking weapons in your armory trying to find something to use on your newest contract. According to the intel you were given the guys you were after were a bunch of small time crooks who where paying off someone in the government to stay ahead of police raids.

At least, they started out small... now they were starting to buy their way into the big leagues with tons of counterfeit cash. Unfortunately for them the government got tired of them avoiding the law and hired you to put a stop to their little money making operation. After adjusting the silencer on a pistol you became frustrated and decided to head out into the garden for a bit to relax and clear your head.

There were hundreds of ways you could go about this assignment, but it was hard to know exactly what to expect. Most small jobs like this had about a dozen guards and maybe a couple heavies in body armor, but something about this one seemed somehow off. You weren't worried about running into trouble but not packing the right equipment could make things much harder. More than anything you wanted to get some of that counterfeit cash for yourself and if you didn't approach the situation just right you could end up losing that opportunity.

Stealth seemed like the best option, since it would prevent them from destroying or locking away the counterfeiter to spite you. On the other hand, taking everyone out silently could leave you with no one to help you access and make the counterfeit cash. It all depended on what they were using to counterfeit the money, where it was located and how secure it was. If it was just one or two guys doing it they'd probably be surrounded by armed guards, if it was a machine it was probably hidden or locked away somewhere.

You sip a glass of wine as you reflect on what information you had been given on the assignment. The location was a run down theater on the far end of Paris on a condemned city block that was due for demolition in a few weeks. The government had managed to get a last minute tip off to their location but they were already packing up to move, in another night they'd have gone to some new place. This job had to happen tonight or not at all.

Though it wasn't usually your style you figured you could just go the Rambo route and gun everyone down since it was such a small gang. Of course that posed a few risks you didn't like taking. On the other hand, the group might be big enough that going in under equipped with just a silenced handgun may prove difficult. One option would be to compromise with a versatile light weapon like a silenced SMG or a scoped revolver. You could also carry a small back up weapon if you need to.

After finishing your wine you decided on a plan of action and head back to the armory to grab some equipment and a proper weapon to do the job with. Once you have everything you would need you get into your limo and give the address to your driver. In just a few hours you would arrive... hopefully with the right plan of action to guarantee your success.
121.title: Making Preparations

choices: With seduction and trickery
With stealth and caution
With raw aggression and ruthlessness
122.content:
You waved over your limo driver as a man in a butler uniform with an arm full of packages hurried to keep up with you. "Put those in the back seat, sweetie. Thanks for your help." you say as you head over to the other side of the car and open the door to the backseat. The young man carefully placed the last package on the seat next to you and gives you a smile. "That should be all the ones we agreed on, will my payment be ready soon?"

You smile as you take your cigarette case and lighter out of your purse. "Of course, dear. The money should be in your account by six, nice working with ya handsome." The man blushed a little and nodded his head as you pulled the door closed and waved goodbye. "Thank you very much, I better get back to the show then." he called as the limo driver started to drive off. You blow him a kiss before turning towards the packages and lighting up a cigarette.

"I do so enjoy the arts." you muse as you exhale a thin cloud of smoke and opened up your personal computer. "But its not even noon yet, I still have plenty of time to get some more work done." After nearly half an hour of looking at job listings and contracts from your associates you decided on a job going down in a few hours just outside of Paris. The route would take you right by your mansion so you would have plenty of time to gear up as well, perfect for a day like today.

"Swing by the mansion, I found a great new contract to finish up the day." you call out to your driver as he pulled off the main road and began heading towards the countryside. With that you closed your computer and relaxed for the rest of the trip home. Roughly an hour later your limo was pulling through a small stone gatehouse at the end of a long driveway in the beautiful french countryside. "We're here, Ms. Red." the driver called back as you put out your cigarette and stepped outside.

"Stay put, someone will be out to collect the paintings while I prepare for my next little assignment. I might be a little while so go ahead and shut off the engine. If I'm not back in an hour go ahead and put it in the garage." you instructed as you slam your door shut and began walking up the steps to your mansion. "Take a break as well, there should be some fresh lemonade in the kitchen." The driver nodded his head and thanked you as a young man in a sweater vest walked past you towards the limo with a maid close behind.

"Careful with those paintings now, I hired you to appraise them, not drop them." you called sternly as you open the front door to your mansion. "Of course, Ms. Red. We'll be very careful!" the maid called back as the door gently closed behind her. You let out a sigh as you head upstairs and take a moment to look over your central courtyard garden from the second floor balcony. Below were a few gardeners tending to rose bushes and overhanging vines while a few butlers and maids walked down the stony walkways to their various destinations.

"It's a shame I can't say and relax here a little longer, but I can't really say no to a payday this good." you say to yourself as you walk away and head back downstairs. After making a few sharp turns down some hallways you came to a small lobby area next to a pair of large hardwood doors secured with a security lock. After digging a keycard out of your purse and swiping it through the reader the large doors opened with a soft click and you continued through a second pair of metal doors into a large metal room stacked with lockers and a few tables.

Most of the lockers were closed shut except for one filled with shelves of ammo and a few gun accessories such as scopes and silencers. The tables had large metal cases resting on top, which were all shut as well save for one containing a collapsible sniper rifle and a few small boxes of equipment. Lastly, there were two men in body armor, one of whom was inspecting a handgun next to the open locker while the other was assembling the sniper rifle.

"Good afternoon boys, how's target practice been today?" you ask as you walk over to one of the lockers and swipe it open with your keycard. "Not bad ma'am. We just got in a new shipment of incendiary ammo from our supplier along with some new accessories for our rifles and handguns. You should check out what we got when you have the time." the man with the handgun replied as he flicked on a laser sight. "Sounds like a good time for another day, I just accepted a new job." you say as you grab a small key from inside the locker. "I'm just here to pick up some gear."

"Ah, good luck then ma'am." the man with the sniper rifle says with a nod as he shut the metal case on the table. "Thanks, but I don't think I'll be needing any luck for this job." you reply as you unlock a door on the far side of the room and step inside. After walking down a short hallway and some stairs you came to a massive underground supply room. The ceiling was only about ten or eleven feet high but the room stretched out so far it looked like a couple of warehouses were stacked side to side.

Nothing here was particularly glamorous like the rest of the mansion, but what it lacked in style it made up for in practicality. Various workers took inventory as they moved crates and stacked tables and desks with boxes. Most of the stuff here was new, fresh off the black market and still waiting to be sorted, which made it the perfect place to pick up and try out some new gear. You walked over to a table with some papers on it and picked up a sheet near the back.

It was a list of your most recent acquisitions purchased the other day when you got in contact with a friend who could get you a discount on some premium stuff he just got in. You had spent well over a million dollars on new toys, but it was all worth it, especially at such a great price. "Let's see here..." you whisper as you look over the list. "I've got the stuff to do things any way I want... I just need to decide on a plan and gear up and I can head out."

How do you plan to do this job?
122.title: New Jobs And New Toys

choices: Try to sneak in through the back entrance
Use stealth to pick off the lookouts then eliminate the rest
Try to sneak around the guards and go straight for the targets
1222.content:
You figured stealth would be the quickest and cleanest way to get this job done and begin planning accordingly. Both parties would probably bring their own security so you were most likely looking at about ten to twenty guys with guns and maybe some other hardware. Nothing too dangerous if you you were smart and careful but too many to effectively deal with using a sniper rifle or something slow.

In the end you decide to pack a new silenced SMG with armor piercing rounds and a couple spare mags as well as a suit of light combat armor. This way you could move through any resistance quickly and efficiently and still keep the element of surprise. You also grabbed some throwing knives, a combat knife and a frag grenade just to be on the safe side and headed out. As you passed by your limo driver on you way to the garage you waved him over to see you off.

"Change of plans, I'm gonna handle this job the quiet way." you inform him as you grab a biker helmet off a nearby shelf and hop on your motorcycle. "Trail me for about an hour and then find a place to park. I might need back up or a quick escape so be ready to move. If you receive a text with an address head there immediately, understood?" The driver nodded his head and walked back over to the limo as you revved up your bike and began speeding down the driveway.

Your driver kept up a good pace as you raced through the french countryside with the wind kissing your face as you darted around sharp turns and past billowing trees. You had about half an hour before the deal was set to go down when your limo driver broke away into the parking lot of a small store next to a gas station, leaving you alone on the road for the last few miles. After slowing your pace through a thick forest area you pull off the main road onto a dirt trail and parked your bike near the peak of a small hill.

With about twenty minutes to go you hurried down the nearby foot path until you came to a small outcropping of rock near the base of the hill that was flat enough to serve as a temporary lookout. You peered through the medium range scope you had affixed to your SMG before leaving home and gazed through the trees and bushes until you spotted a building down below near the road. "Ah, there we go." you whisper as you head further down the trail to get a bit closer.

A large military vehicle pulled into the parking lot of the motel just as you took cover in the dense foliage near the end of the trail. A second vehicle soon arrived behind it and several men in fatigues and berets climbed out. A man with a thick beard and a chest full of shiny medals stepped out and was immediately saluted by the others before heading around to the main entrance of the building. "I think I found the warlord, now I just need to find the other guy and I'll be ready to move."

You look through the scope at the parking lot and notice two men in suits and sunglasses talking near a red, white and blue limo parked near the back of the lot. "Hmmm, looks like the suit was already here. I better move before they wrap this up and decide to pull out." you say softly as you take a quick look around the motel. In addition to the two guys near the limo there was a sniper on the roof, two more guys in suits doing patrols along the second floor, two guys in fatigues patrolling the ground floor and a suit with a shotgun stationed near the back entrance.

"About half a dozen guys guarding the outside with probably a dozen or so either inside or at spots I can't see, this shouldn't be too hard." you say to yourself as you move down to the end of the trail and take cover in the tall weeds alongside the road. Time to get to work...
1222.title: Stalking Your Prey

choices: Try to take out the group near the cars
Try and kill the group searching for you
Try and cause a distraction before moving in
12222.content:
You figured things would be easiest if you took out some of the guards first, after all, a few guys with guns you could handle... twenty you could not. You look around and zone in on the sniper with your scope. He was clearly the most dangerous target, but taking him out would greatly eliminate the threat the others posed. The only problem is that his death carried a great risk of alerting the others, you'd have to time this just right if you were going to pull it off.

You wait a few moments for another guard to open the door to the room where your targets were and take careful aim with your silenced SMG. Just as the guard is about to close the door you open fire and unleash a quick burst of rounds at the sniper. The bullets find their mark instantly and the sniper collapses onto the roof as tiny trails of red burst from the back of his head. The door slams shut just as his body falls with a loud thud. The guard pauses to look at the door for a moment before shrugging and moving on with his patrol. None of them suspected a thing.

You breathe a quick sigh of relief as you reload your SMG with a fresh clip and move to a slightly better vantage point. Two more bursts of fire cut down two men patrolling the side of the motel with ease and you sneak across the road once you are sure no one will spot you. Another guard approaches you from the back as you close in on the bodies and you pop off some more rounds just as he turns around the corner. Luckily, no one saw his body go down and you quickly move his corpse before another guy checks on the back of the motel.

You drag the bodies behind a nearby bush where they wouldn't be easily spotted and pile their guns under a few other bushes nearby. Your SMG still had plenty of ammo left but something heavier could be useful if things went sideways and nothing beat a shotgun or an assault rifle in a close range firefight. Once the dead guards and their weapons were secured you sneak around to the back of the motel and slip into the dense foliage as you move onward.

Another guy slips away to enjoy a smoke break and you put him down with a quick knife throw that pierces his heart. He lets out a single grunt as he he drops his cigarette and clutches his chest. You walk over and stomp out the cigarette as he tries to raise his revolver. You merely grab it from him before he can fire and finish him off by putting your combat knife through his throat. This made for a quiet, if messy, end and his lifeless body slumps to the ground as you place the revolver near a rock at the base of a tree.

You were making good progress but it seemed like the remaining guards were starting to get a bit suspicious. A few men with rifles and shotguns grouped together near the cars as another group headed around the motel towards the spot you came in at. It probably wouldn't take them long to find the bodies and even if they didn't you couldn't exactly scrub away some blood off the wall from your most recent kill. Sooner or later they would find you, it was just a matter of time.

Thinking quickly, you scope out the guys near the cars. There were five in total, decently armed but clustered together. You could take them all out but that ran the risk of drawing attention, even if none of them alerted the others their bodies could set off a car alarm by accident. The other group was smaller, only three or four, but they were actively looking for you and on alert, making them much harder to surprise. Once false move and they'd light you up like a christmas tree.

Whatever move you're gonna make, better do it quick!
12222.title: Silent Assassinations

choices: Use your grenade to blow the vehicles and cut off their escape
Grab a shotgun and rush the building
Run around the back to catch them by surprise
122222.content:
You quickly move along the wall of the motel as you head back the way you came and take cover near the corner as the guys searching for you begin walking closer. It sounded like they were all together but you couldn't be completely sure, unfortunately it look'd like you would just have to take a chance and hope your presence isn't detected just yet. With a deep breath you run forward and make a quick dive as you round the corner.

Two surprised goons raised their guns but your SMG fire lit them up before they could get off a shot. The bodies fell with a soft thud as the third guy quickly turned his head to see what the commotion was. You gaze through the scope and pull the trigger just as he points his gun in your direction. He was a good distance away and partially obscured by a thin tree but the last few rounds in your clip peppered his body and dropped him before he could fire.

You go in to move closer as you load a fresh clip and toss the empty mag when a shot rings out from a revolver and almost grazes your shoulder. Shit! This guy wasn't dead yet, the bullets must have missed his vitals! "What the hell was that?" one of the men by the vehicles shouted as he and a couple other guys began running around the front of the motel to check on their allies. "Goddamn it!" you curse under your breath as you run up and finish off the guy with a knife to the throat. "Here they come!"

At this point you realized all bets were off and these guys were now out for blood so you dropped your SMG and picked up the assault rifle you had stashed nearby before ducking behind some bushes. Three new guards carrying a shotgun, pistols and an assault rifle rounded the corner and immediately screamed in surprise at seeing the carnage you had laid out in front of them. "Someone took out our guys, one of you two dumb fucks go warn the boss while the other helps me find this little cunt, they can't have gone far!" the man in charge yells as one of his underlings turns to run back to get the others.

"Not so fast..." you think to yourself as you target the guy who was turned around and open fire. A loud roar shattered the silence as you drilled several new holes into his back and then spray his two friends with the remainder of the magazine. All three men let out soft grunts of pain as they fell and you rushed out of your hiding place to confront the others. No doubt they were all alerted now and even with half their number dead could still assist their bosses in an escape attempt. You couldn't allow that.

More voices began shouting from the top floor of the motel as more security personnel rushed out to deal with the threat. You were in the homestretch now, you just had to finish off the last dozen or so soldiers and you'd be ready to claim one hell of a nice payday. Time to set up your final move...
122222.title: Going Loud!

choices: Through the abandoned building
Through the hole in the wall
Through the sewer
124.content:
You got off the bus at the station near the warehouse district and followed the instructions on your GPS to a nearby storage facility. Once there you head over to a large locker marked with the number you had been given. "Yep, looks like this is the place." you note as you fish a keycard out of your purse and swipe it through the reader. With a soft ding the locker clicked open and you pulled away the door to find yourself staring at a small armory.

The top shelf was lined with molotovs, incendiary grenades and matches while the bottom of the locker contained a compact flamethrower with a nozzle extension sitting right beside it. "Well well now, what do we have here?" you grin as you pick up the flamethrower and check its fuel tank. "It's full and I've got an extra in here just in case... plus a nozzle extension that'll probably boost the range of this little beauty by at least 30 feet. Nice."

After stocking up on what you could carry you notice a small paper note on the top shelf and quickly unfold it. It contained instructions on how to get to the pot farm without being seen from the storage facility. There were a few different options, but each posed some sort of risk. After deciding what path to take you head out the back door around the storage facility guards and took cover behind a nearby delivery truck while they passed by.

Once the area was clear again you moved to a nearby stone wall and carefully moved through a few thick bushes to a large gap that had been knocked out of it. It was a bit difficult to climb over with the flamethrower in hand but you managed to get through without making a single sound. You were now in a large grassy lot filled with a few small trees and vines growing along the sides of the wall. From here you would have to choose your path carefully to get to your target.

According to the note the building next to the lot's main gate was abandoned and connected to the warehouse itself, but was likely patrolled by guards. The second direction you could go was through a small hole in the wall of the far side of the lot, which would take you directly to the warehouse. It was the quickest route, but also lacked cover, which would make you easier to spot. Lastly, you could open a manhole cover in the corner of the lot and travel though the sewer. This was probably the safest and stealthiest route, but also the dirtiest and ran the risk of damaging some of your supplies.

Which way should you go?
124.title: Firestarter

choices: Repossession
Flu Shot
Cyber Heist
Beer Run
Lost And Found
13.content:
Name: Desmond Bridges

Age: 25

Sex: Male

Race: African American

Height: 5'10

Appearance: Typically sporting a shaved head and chin Desmond doesn't stand out too much in a crowd, which is just how he likes it. He may sometimes wear a short goatee or some stubble, but usually just to serve as a disguise or help hide his identity. His most distinguishing features are his beautiful light blue eyes and calming smile. He doesn't particularly care about fashion, but always wears stylish clothing whenever he's on a job, be it a simple suit and tie or designer jacket and jeans.

Home Base: Hacker Cave. An unknown location somewhere in South America. Desmond prefers to constantly stay on the move and has many safe houses all across the world, but he keeps returning to the Hacker Cave again and again. The place is fairly small due to being built into a cave on a remote hillside, though it has everything Desmond could ask for. The whole thing is comprised of only two rooms, a computer room and a small bathroom. The walls are all lined with monitors and various screens and speakers and the floor is littered with dirty clothes and various empty snack boxes. Of note are the thick reinforced walls and concealed and password locked front door.

Skills/Perks: Desmond is a master hacker and tech expert. In addition to building his own drones and specialized robots he has an extensive knowledge of computers and security systems. Basically, he can rewire anything more advanced than a wristwatch and disable anything that he can't reprogram. He also has an extensive grasp of cryptography and can decode almost anything. His skill with technology is so good that he often makes his own gear and even improves the gear of his allies.
