Weaknesses: He isn't particularly bad at anything, but not particularly good either. He can drive, shoot and improvise decently enough, but he doesn't excel at any of those things. He works great as part of a team or in a support role, but is under-equipped to deal with most missions by himself.

Starting Assets: An advanced computer network that provides top of the line security and internet access. Several drones, turrets and basic combat robots. A secure bank account with a moderate amount of every currency on the planet for last minute expenses and trips. Several civilian grade firearms such as hunting rifles, handguns and the odd shotgun. A selection of computer viruses and a logbook with blackmail information. Finally, a weapon workstation for maintenance and crafting.

Starting Contracts

Repossession - A recent client of Sue's has stiffed her for all of the work she did on his new sports car. For revenge she wants you to steal back or destroy the car, along with any of his friend's cars that you can get your hands on. Risk here is minimal and so is the reward unless you bring back a lot of the cars. Pay: $1,000,000 - $5,000,000

Flu Shot - A massive technological company is giving Desmond a lot of trouble with their new computer security systems. If this keeps up for much longer Desmond's virus won't be any match for their protection systems. The goal here is simple, infiltrate their company H.Q. in Brazil and get a copy of their master program before they can cause any more trouble. It'll be a pretty hard job, especially if it goes loud. Getting a hold of that master program will be well worth it though, not to mention the money you could drain from their accounts while you're there. Pay: $5,000,000 - $50,000,000

Cyber Heist - A group of famous bank robbers are planning one of the biggest heists in recent memory by knocking over the Blue Siren casino in Las Vegas. The only catch is that the casino has an entirely digital vault security system and they need a master hacker to help them reach and open it. In addition to providing intel and support Desmond will need to make sure the crew gets the job done and escapes in one piece. This one will be tricky, but the potential rewards are pretty damn tempting. Pay: $150,000,000 - $250,000,000

Beer Run - Some outlaw moonshiners in one of Brazil's biggest slums have stumbled upon a potent and dangerous formula. They call their secret blend Ambrosia and it's become quite popular thanks to its cheap cost and potent kick. Busting up this little operation would make for a nice little payday and the recipe to make this stuff would be a nice bonus. Fairly low risk and with good rewards, but you never know what kind of heat these guys might be packing. Pay: $10,000,000 - $20,000,000

Lost And Found - A recent spike in missing persons has Brazilian authorities worried that a serial killer or human trafficker may be at work. Luckily, Desmond has a special tracking program that might just lead him to the culprit. All of the missing people are college aged kids, some local and some tourists. This contract offers good rewards, but its unknown just what kind of danger may be in store making this a risky job to complete. Pay: $5,000,000 - $25,000,000
13.title: The Hacker

choices: Scope out the group with a drone
Head over and talk to them
See if the car you need is parked nearby
131.content:
You turned on the radio as you pulled out into the main highway and admired the setting sun through the trees lining the side of the road. You had planned to take the weekend off, but some dumb douche decided to try and fuck over Sue, one of your more important contacts and you ended up accepting a last minute job to teach the guy some manners. This wouldn't be a big job, just some street punks and maybe some cops if they got involved, though Sue offered a decent paycheck for the work, which you were happy to accept.

In the back trunk were a pair of drones, a remote car, some tech gadgets and a few spare sets of clothes in case you needed a disguise. You also had a backpack in the front passenger seat with a switchblade and handgun inside it, along with a couple bats in the back, one aluminum and one wood. Sue had made it clear she wanted the car retrieved if possible, though sending a message not to screw her again would suffice if you felt like getting messy.

A ring echoed on your cellphone as you swerved around a tight turn that hugged the hillside running along the coast. "Hello, it's D." you answered as you pulled aside for another car to pass by on the narrow road. "Hey, its Sue, I just got word that our boy and his buddies are heading down to the beach just outside the city. They should have some of their best vehicles there, so I'll be happy to pay for any extras you can grab."

You grinned as you pulled over to the side of the road to program your GPS with the new coordinates. "Damn girl, I didn't bring the equipment for extra targets, but I might be able to set something up. I know a few guys in the area who may be able to help me. Let me call you back once I access the situation." you reply as you write down the info on the other cars. Sue tells you not to worry as long as you deal with the guy who stiffed her before excusing herself to take another call and hanging up.

"Well alright then..." you say happily as you examine the car models you had been given on your laptop. All of the vehicles were high end model sportscars made during the past decade, real quality merch even without the upgrades and work they would have done on them. This could end up being a very lucrative endeavor if you played your cards right.

After you were done with the intel you pulled back onto the road and headed down the hill towards a beach that stretched all the way from the distant coast to the city on the far horizon. "I'm just about there, I better make some calls before I arrive and see what I can do about these extra rides they got." you note as you dial up a number. After a few quick conversations you had a whole crew on standby to help out if needed. You were ready.

You parked your own car near the far side of a lot on the edge of the beach near a strip mall. You got out and headed into a nearby liquor store to buy a case of beer and then headed back to your vehicle. After pouring one of the beers out you filled it up with a water bottle and made sure you had your handgun in your backpack before heading out onto the beach. As you strolled past a few people packing up for the night you take a few sips of your fake drink and try to act casual.

Off near the docks were a few young collage age girls talking with a group of people in their early to late twenties. One of the men in the group had a dyed red beard, sunglasses and a blue baseball cap... this was your guy. You watched the group for a few minutes as they walked off towards a cluster of small house boats where someone was barbecuing some hamburgers. With a sly smile you then headed back to your car to plan your next move.
131.title: A Night At The Beach

choices: Meet up with the crew
Get the supplies
Wait for K to get back and ask his opinion
133.content:
You checked your watch as you stepped off the plane and headed into the airport lobby. It was just five minutes past 9:00am and the weather would likely be heating up tremendously by noon. Just another day in Las Vegas. You chuckled to yourself as you checked out and reclaimed your luggage. It was amazing what you could smuggle into the country with a few greased palms and a fake passport.

The sun began slowly climbing into the sky from the distant horizon as various big shots and gamblers collected their bags and chatted on their cell phones. It felt strange to be back on American soil after everything that happened before, but with airport security out of the way you were confident in things going smoothly today. As you walked out of the main lobby onto the sidewalk outside you were quickly approached by a man in a black suit and tie.

"Desmond?" the guy asked with a slight cockney accent as he took a drag off his cigarette. You simply nodded your head and replied "Yeah, you the driver?" The guy gestured for you to follow him and led you to an impressive limo decked out with a cyberpunk paintjob on the front hood. "Oh shit, that's a nice ride man." you say in an impressed tone as you climb into the backseat while the driver put out his cigarette and climbed in the front.

"Glad you liked the ride, D." he replied as he revved up the engine and pulled out of the airport. "The other guys are waiting at a local hotel near the outskirts of Vegas. It cost us a pretty penny, but we'll have all of the privacy we need to plan the job. I'm K, by the way." he finished as he turned on the radio. You smile as you kick your feet back and take a bottle of champagne out of a tray of ice and pop the cork.

"Nice to meet you, K." you reply as you pour yourself a drink. "Sounds like the crew has done a good job getting things set up. I couldn't bring all of my toys on the flight, but we'll make due. I just need to pick up some stuff from the tech store and I'll have everything covered. Jammers, recorders, bugs, robotics... you name it." You spend the rest of the drive chatting about the heist and discussing what you'd each do with your share of the money.

After arriving at the hotel K dropped you off to go meet the rest of the crew while he parked the car. After thanking him for the ride you watched him drive around to the back and turned to face the main building. It was an impressive structure with a tropical theme judging by the exotic plants and palm trees planted along the sidewalk. It wasn't particularly tall but everything from the windows to the front doors screamed luxury.

"Damn, I gotta give it to the crew... they sure have good taste in accommodations." you say happily as you take out your cell phone and check the time. It was about two hours until noon and the temperature was already rising. Should you get your shopping done now before it gets too hot or wait and do it after meeting your new partners?
133.title: Welcome To Sin City

choices: Introduce yourself
Ask about the upcoming job
Ask them who they are
1331.content:
As much as you wanted to prepare for the job you also didn't want to pass up the opportunity to make a good first impression with the people you'd be working with. After all, it was important for a team to get along and have each other's backs if it wanted to succeed, something you had learned in the past from working with crews who only had the score in mind. If everyone manage to do a good job on this Blue Siren heist you'd all soon be millionaires.

You headed into the main lobby and basked in the refreshingly cool air that washed over you while admiring the interior design of the hotel. It was a bit cheesy with palm tree silhouettes painted on the walls and employees wearing tropical floral print shirts but it was still a pretty nice place for being so far from the main strip. After checking in at the front desk you hopped onto the elevator and took it up to room 311 on one of the upper floors.

As you approached the door you heard cheering and hoots of laughter on the other side. It sounded almost like some sort of big party was going on, which was strange. You checked the room number that had been sent by the crew and sure enough it was the right place. "Alright then, here goes nothing I guess..." you mumble to yourself as you swipe your keycard in the slot and turn the handle.

Inside the room were three men in suits, a lean Asian man in a white leisure suit with black undershirt, a Caucasian man with a light blue pinstripe suit and blue tie and another Caucasian man with a goatee and gold necklace in a casual brown suit. All of them were enjoying some booze and barely noticed you walk in. What really caught your eye though, was the buxom stripper dancing on a thick wooden coffee table while her partner gave the Asian guy a lap dance.

"Hey hey hey, you D?!" the Asian guy shouts cheerfully as he pours himself a fresh glass of bourbon. The other two guys look you over as they take a sip out of their own drinks, a martini and a glass of rum and coke. This wasn't what you expected, but as long as these guys were professional once the job started you didn't mind a little bit of celebrating early. "Yeah, I'm D. Nice to meet you all." you reply as you sit your stuff down in an empty chair.

What should you do now?
1331.title: Meeting The Team

choices: Hit the store early in the morning
Hit the store in the late afternoon
Hit the store in the evening
13311.content:
You quickly grabbed a free seat on a nearby couch across from the other three and kicked your shoes off. "Celebrating a bit early aren't we?" you say with a smile as you grab a few bottles off a nearby tray and start mixing yourself up a Mojito. "Not that I'm complaining. I just flew in from South America, I'm the tech expert for this little job if you hadn't guessed yet. I'll still need to pick up some supplies before I'll be ready to get to work but that shouldn't be a problem. I'm looking forward to working with you all."

The Asian guy nods as he takes a sip of his drink and then gestures for the stripper giving him a lap dance to take a break. "Cool, so you're the hacker then? Nice." he replies as he leans forward to shake your hand. "I'm T, the guy who organized this little group and the one who's in charge of securing our equipment. The guys over on the other couch are O and B, O's the guy in blue and B's the guy in brown. O's our resident stealth expert and B's been an off the radar doctor for going on ten years now, he'll keep us patched up if things get dicey. Say hello boys."

The two men nod in your direction as you take a sip out of your Mojito. "Like I said, good to meet you all. I take it K is our getaway driver?" you ask as the man himself walks through the door. "Yep, our friend K here is the best in the business, hasn't let us down yet." T replies as K takes a spot on the couch next to you. "You flatter me T, I'm glad my work here is appreciated. Now, hand me a damn drink already, while you lot were partying some of us were busy running errands... like picking up our guest here."

You all share a laugh as you pass K a few of the bottles off the tray. You spend the next few hours talking and by the time you realize how long you've spent getting to know each other it was already the hot part of the day. "Guess those supplies will have to wait until tomorrow." you think to yourself as you down your third Mojito. "Ah well, today we'll party and tomorrow we can start preparing for the job." As the afternoon fades into the evening you set up a schedule with K and plan out a course of action for the next day.
13311.title: The Crew

choices: Try to negotiate
Try to sneak inside unnoticed
Try a direct assault
134.content:
You check the clip in your handgun as you hop out of the taxi cab before tossing the diver a few bills on the front passenger side seat through the rolled down window. "Thanks for the ride, keep the change." you call over as the man behind the wheel revs up the engine and speeds off without a word. You knew this was a bad part of town but his eagerness to leave made you somewhat uneasy.

You turned away from the main road with a sigh and looked at the crowded and congested backstreet that stood before you. Tall rundown buildings lined the narrow path forward and several bums and vagrants were sitting around on loose piles of trash such as old tires or broken wooden chairs. A few were gambling or drinking, some were passed out on cardboard boxes and one was in the process of injecting a needle into his arm.

"This looks like a pretty rough neighborhood, glad I came prepared." you whisper to yourself as you begin walking past a couple of kids playing with small spinning tops. Most of the residents ignored you as you moved past them but a few gave you dirty glares and one even brandished a small knife as you passed by his shop. You kept your hand on the gun in your front jacket pocket, just in case someone tried to pull a weapon on you.

In addition to the 9mm handgun you had also packed a detachable silencer, taser and multi-tool with a small knife blade as well to give yourself a good variety of protection. You also had a flying drone in your backpack along with a small robotic remote car that you could equip with various attachments, like a camera or flashlight. More important than all of that however, was a lightweight flak jacket you had purchased off the black market before arriving here. It was a bit old and worn but it could easily save your life against smaller caliber firearms.

You took a moment to rest near a telephone pole and pulled out your phone. After checking the map app you had installed the other day you see that your current destination was just a quarter of a mile up the road. The building was an old slaughter house that closed down about a decade ago before being bought by a local gang leader to use as a storage facility and meeting place. It wasn't even a secret that the place was being used for smuggling and drug running, the gang had the local cops on their payroll and most residents knew what would happen if anyone tried to mess with them.

"I guess there's a few ways I can do this..." you think to yourself as you download a blueprint of the building. "The place has two floors, a lower factory area and some offices on the upper level. Probably about a dozen guys in total including their boss, unlikely to be too well armed but probably carrying some decent street guns like uzis or sawn-off shotguns. I could try talking to them, I have enough money to offer a good bribe... but things could get ugly if negotiations went south. Let's see, how am I gonna do this...?"
134.title: The Bad Part of Town

choices: "Try to zoom in with our hidden camera."
"Try to sneak closer so I can record them."
"Stay put, we can still follow them if they don't see us."
135.content:
You cracked open a fresh energy drink as your contact headed into position. Two days ago you had accepted a job looking into some missing people and traced most of the disappearances to a shady part of some backwater city know for its high crime rates and police corruption. A perfect place for some sicko to kidnap victims and take them back to their lair to do god knows what... hopefully that was coming to a close now that a skilled merc was involved with the case.

"You got everything?" you ask over a hidden speaker your contact Chris had hidden in his ear. After a brief hiss of static a familiar voice came over the two way communicator. "Yeah, I got my gun and taser and I've been tryin' to keep a low profile. I'm definitely starting to get a good picture of our culprit though. Most of the missing persons came into contact with a middle aged drifter type in a suit. I've been keeping an eye out, I'll let you know when anything turns up."

You took a quick sip out of your drink and open up a video feed from a secret camera Chris had in his hat and took a look around at the busy city streets. "Alright, man." you reply as you take note of a nearby street address. "You're heading into some dangerous territory, be careful." Chris laughed and replied that he would before cutting off the mic and heading into a nearby bar. You quickly opened a new feed of the interior and looked around at the patrons.

Most of the drunks and bums looked shady, but none fit the profile of the suspect. "I don't think the guy we're looking for is here, boss. I'm going to head out and try some of the other places nearby." Chris reported as he walked back out the front door. For the next hour you both had little luck as most of the people he encountered were too drunk, horny or stupid to be the suave mystery man.

Just when Chris was about to call it quits for the night he noticed a man in a trenchcoat and fedora walking down the opposite side of the street. It was hard to see his face but he looked like a dead ringer for the description provided by most of your contacts. "Boss, do you see-" "I do." you cut him off as you try to get a zoom in on his face from a nearby street camera. "Follow him, see if you can get some kind of ID on him, a license plate or credit card number, anything like that and we'll have a good lead."

Chris nodded as he followed the guy around the block to a library and down a narrow alleyway leading to a small parking lot where another man was waiting for him. Chris could get closer, but it would be very risky so he took cover behind a nearby dumpster as the men began talking. Unfortunately, there were no cameras in the immediate area and it was hard to hear anything either of them said. "What's the call boss? They won't be here long and we need to make a move." Chris warned as he peeked around the corner.
135.title: Tracking A Lead

choices: Listen to the audio
Check out the car photos
Wait for Chris to return and go over the evidence together
1353.content:
Chris sighs as he leans back against the wall and takes out his phone to try and record anything that might be useful. Even if he and you couldn't hear the men talking a phone might be able to pick up something useful you could use later. You and Chris waited anxiously as the two shady guys chatted for a few minutes before walking over to a car parked near the far end of the parking lot. "Shit, boss... I think they're leaving!" Chris whispered urgently as he tried to move closer.

"Damn it, don't lose them now!" you whisper back a bit louder than you intended. "Try to get a photo of the vehicle, a license plate, a fucking bumper sticker, anything to identify their ride!" Chris panted nervously as he rushed behind a parked truck and waited for the rev of an engine. As the car pulled out of the lot he leaned past the rear of the truck just enough to snap a few quick photos as the suspects disappeared from sight.

Once he was sure he was in the clear Chris reported in. "Yo boss, they're gone. What's our next move?" he asks as he looks over the photos he took on his phone. "Did you get any good shots of the car?" you reply as you dig a spare memory drive out of a drawer and stick it in your laptop. "Not really, I got a couple pictures, but they're a little blurry. We should be able to get a solid read on the model of car though."

You rub your chin as a folder containing a list of car models from 1990-2008 pops up on your desktop. "Alright, alright I think we can work with this. Get back when you can and send me what you have. If I can at least identify the vehicle it'll be a decent start." Chris replies in the affirmative and begins heading back to his own car. In a few minutes a fresh notification popped up on your computer with the photos and recorded audio.

"Alright Chris, let's see what you got us..." you wonder aloud as you open the files.

141.content:
You took down a few notes as you walked through the long hallway to your room on the 18th floor of Tokyo's world famous Blue Garden Hotel and Resort. You had been posing as a guest for the past weekend and had observed an auction taking place in the back lobby. In addition to various antiques and relics there was a near pristine suit of valuable samurai armor... just as your boss Ryu had predicted.

The thing had been sold to a wealthy historical club who would no doubt seal it away in some private museum for their eyes only. At least, that was probably their plan. If you and the Sakura Garden Yakuza had a say the treasure would soon be finding a new home safe and sound in Ryu's office, where it would likely be departing to a rich underground collector shortly afterwards. Whatever its fate, you had been promised a large payday for securing the armor by any means necessary and you intended to collect.

As you swipe your keycard through the scanner on your door you take a moment to reflect on your days working for the mafia back in America. Your old boss wasn't as friendly as Ryu, but the guy had a strong moral code and did a lot to look out for his crew. You had actually been up for a big promotion before you ended up getting sent overseas to oversee a budding partnership with the local yakuza. Nearly two years later and you had succeeded in establishing strong ties between the two groups, but the SGY still had a ways to go before they'd be the dominant players in Japan.

You had been instructed to return once you had helped remove any rival factions and ensure a long prosperous future between the two organizations. Things were progressing smoothly enough with the SGY now one of the bigger gangs in Japan, but you still had a few more years worth of work before you could return home. You weren't complaining though, with the loans you had to take out to help build your empire you saw this assignment as one big extended vacation. Yeah, you were starting to receive a few angry messages about paying back your debt, but that's what this job was for.

"Once I pay back that loan and smooth things out with the boys in the SGY I'll be heading back out west so I should enjoy the time I've got left here." you note as you change into a silk robe and order a bottle of champagne and ice to be brought up to the room. The boss man had provided you plenty of extra cash to case this place and you weren't going to let a single yen go to waste. Just as you lit up a cigar you hear a soft knock at the door and get up to answer it.

"Who is it?" you call as you exhale a cloud of smoke. A young woman's voice then piped up from the other side. It was sweet and smooth like honey, but hid a tinge of venom that you were quick to pick up on. "Mr. David? Is that you? It's room service, I have your order for you." she replied sweetly. "Ah, that was quick." you joke as you open the door and gesture to an open seat near a wooden table sitting next to the bed. The woman silently walked in and took a seat before lighting up a cigarette and relaxing a bit.

"You can have a cigar or two if you like, I don't buy the cheap stuff." you offer as you sit down in your own chair and pull a small box off a nearby shelf. "How kind, you really are a gentleman." the woman replied as she stubbed out her cigarette and took a cigar from the box. You picked up your lighter off the table and lit it for her. After exhaling a plume of smoke she crossed her legs and straightened her posture.

"Thank you, now are you ready for your order?" the woman asked with a sly smile. "I have a few other "rooms" to visit yet and I want to keep on schedule." You nod and lean back in your chair as you pull out your notebook. "I was only able to get a few looks at the armor before it got packed up inside the safe, but they're keeping it in a massive vault near the top floor. Expect at least a dozen guards and security personnel. The lock is entirely electronic, no lockpicking I'm afraid, you'll need to figure out how to open it or get something that can get through it. Looks pretty sturdy, I doubt a drill would cut it."

You scribbled down a few more details she gave as another knock came from the door. It was the actual room service this time, a man in a suit with your champagne and ice. You quickly thank him with a 10,000 yen tip and send him on his way while your lovely guest resumes talking. From the sound of things you would ultimately need three separate keycards from the guards and a password or something powerful enough to crack over 5 inches of hard metal. No easy task.

"Thank you my dear, you've been most helpful. I believe the price we agreed on was 100,000 yen?" The woman nodded as you popped the cork on the champagne and grabbed a few glasses. You both declare a toast to new fortunes and take a sip from your glasses. After finishing her drink the woman pocketed the money you had laid out on the table and checked her address book.

"You know, I have a few friends who might be able to provide some of what you need to get this suit of armor you're after. If you cut me a small piece of the pie I can provide you a lot of help." she offered as she gave you a piece of paper with a few phone numbers on it. "They don't come cheap, but I can probably negotiate a few big discounts here and there, plus it'll save you some expenses in the long run, what do you say?"

After a moment of thinking you finish off the rest of your glass and pour another for the both of you. "I'm not sure, the boss laid out a very precise expense plan for this job. If I hire any outside help it comes from my own pocket." you finally say as you take a drag off your cigar. "Look, think about it a little more. My help won't be cheap but it'll pay off in the long run, I promise. I'm gonna pay a quick trip to the ladies room, give me your answer when I get out." she replied as she got up and excused herself.

You weren't an expert when it came to things like this, a little help from some actual experts with high end equipment would make things a lot easier. On the other hand, it would eat up a good chunk of your profits once the job was actually completed. The woman would be back in a few minutes and you needed to decide on an answer for her. Should you let her join the crew or not?

143.content:
You lit up a cigar as you look over at the clock on the wall. Your boss had called ahead to tell you he'd be dropping by to collect his cut of the resort money early this month. You knew this wasn't about money though, since your boss was usually patient when it came time to pay the rent. No, there was something else your boss wanted to discuss with you face to face, otherwise he would have just waited until the next meeting to bring it up.

You lean back in your chair and blow a ring of smoke as you finish counting the stack of bills on your desk. This had been a productive month, if nothing else Ryu wouldn't be able to complain about his employees work ethic. A knock then came from the door and distracted you from your thoughts of profits. "Sorry for the interruption. May I come in, sir?" came the voice of a yakuza guard through a two-way speaker near the door. You sigh and buzz him in.

"The boss here?" you ask as you put away most of the cash on the desk and lock everything up. "Yes, sir. He arrived just a minute ago and headed to the onsen, the private indoor one. He requests your presence immediately." the guard says with a bow as you put out your cigar and get up from the desk. "Sure thing, its not polite to keep the boss man waiting." you smile as you pick up the money you had left out on the desk.

"Stay here and lock the place up for me. I won't be coming back to the office tonight." you say cheerfully as you begin heading down the stairs. The man nodded and headed back to secure everything for the night. "Thanks." you call back as you step off the last step and head out the front door of your luxury manor home. "The big man usually saves personal visits for special occasions, I'm kinda excited to see what's up."

It only took you a few minutes to walk down the narrow stone pathway from the front of your home though the garden next to the main resort. Once you arrived at the onsen you find a young woman in a formal kimono waiting for you outside the front door. "Good evening, sir. The boss is waiting for you in the private bath." she greeted as she opened the door for you and followed you inside. Before heading off to the locker room you hand the woman this months take and tell her to deliver it straight to the boss.

"Of course, sir. Have a good evening." she replies as you thank her and close the door. After storing your clothes in your private locker you head through the door to the hallway leading to the private indoor bath. The room wasn't particularly small, but it paled in comparison to the grand outdoor bath and hot springs that drew most of the Sakura Resort's business. Still, it couldn't be beat for privacy with its soundproof walls and expertly decorated interior.

Waiting inside the large bath pool were three people, two women and a man along with two other men in suits standing near the door. The man sitting in the water was covered in tattoos from his neck to his feet and was wearing a pair of thin gold-rimmed pitch black sunglasses. Both of the two women bathing next to him were buxom and slender, one had almost as many tattoos as the man she was leaning on while the other was fair skinned without so much as a beauty mark. Each woman was attractive and young though the woman with tattoos was a bit older than her counterpart, looking to be in her late twenties or early thirties while the other looked to be barely eighteen.

"Ah, Micheal my friend. So good of you to join us on such short notice. Please have a seat, we've much business to discuss." Ryu said as he leaned back and put his arms around the women beside him. You flashed them both a smile. "Isn't it against the rules to wear sunglasses in the onsen? Also, you sure you want me to join you in there? Your company might get... distracted..." you reply slyly as you gently tug your bath towel loose. The two women giggled in admiration as Ryu let out a chuckle.

"You can break a few of the rules when you own the place." Ryu said as he gestured for one of his men to bring refreshments. "Now quit worrying about modesty and get in here already so we can talk." The women began laughing as you walked over and threw the towel off, which caused them to start laughing in a more awkward tone as you dipped into the water while they both blushed slightly. "You ladies feel free to join me over here if you get cold."

The women smile as Ryu hugged them closer and lowered his glasses a little. "Alright, playboy. If you're done joking around I need you to listen, or should I be trusting Dai with this job?" The mention of your rival's name almost made you frown, but you managed to keep your cool and merely crossed your arms. "Alright alright, boss man. Fun's over. I'm listening." you reply as you did your best to look serious.

"Good." Ryu replied as he took two highball glasses off a tray his guard had sat down near the edge of the bath. "Truth be told, I doubt Daisuke could find his own ass if he fell in a toilet. The man has brawn and attitude... but no finesse or subtlety." Ryu laments as he pours some expensive imported rum into each glass and garnished them with a slice of lemon. "I need my best man on this job. No fuck ups, you understand?"

You could tell by the tone in his voice that this was something big you were about to discuss. "I'm all ears, sir. What do you need done?" you ask politely as a guard handed you a glass of rum. Ryu smiled and continued. "Just last week I met with a man working for one of the bigger triads in china, Golden Ocean. You heard of them?" You nodded your head and took a sip out of your glass. "Good. I don't have to tell you how much it would benefit us to work with them, especially after most of our rivals failed to impress."

You raised an eyebrow as you recalled the news you'd heard that Golden Ocean was expanding into japan. These guys didn't play around and were pretty ruthless... they could be a great ally or a deadly foe. "You've made contact with them?" you ask as you take another sip of your drink. "Yes." Ryu answered as he folded his fingers together and leaned forward. "This could be big, Micheal. We need the support right now, especially with how much expanding we've done in the past few months. We need to keep the pressure on the other yakuza."

You smile as you stretch your arms out and take a deep breath. "I take it they want to set up a get together? You want me to run security for a little meet and greet?" You take another long sip out of your drink as Ryu smiled back and nodded. "Indeed, I just received a call from a man named Mr. Hong, he is a red pole for the Golden Ocean and answers directly to their leader. His brother, a fellow red pole who goes by "Scarface" wants to bring his daughter as a last minute guest."

"I see." you reply with a smirk. "Poor guy couldn't find a sitter for his kid so I'm gonna be stuck on babysitting duty? What's the little brat's name?" Ryu let out a laugh as he relaxed in the warm water of the onsen. "Mei Hong, she isn't a brat though. She's well behaved if her father is to be believed. Look, I don't expect you to like her, just get along. Put your pride aside and indulge her, take her on a shopping spree if she wants, see a movie, whatever. Just keep her safe and content. Can you do this?"

You let out a big sigh and finish off your drink. "How can I say no boss? This is big, something that could put us on the map. I'm used to having more fun on the job, but screw it. If keeping the kid from taking a bullet puts us in her daddy's good graces I'll do it. Me and the guys won't let so much as a fly land on her."

Ryu smiled as he downed the last of his own drink and poured another. "Excellent, you haven't disappointed me yet... I know you can do this. Their plane will be arriving in at noon tomorrow at a secret location. I'll make sure you get the address, now go ahead and retire for the night. You'll need to get up early to be on time to pick them up." You nod to your boss and give the two women one last wink before climbing out of the water and putting your towel back on. After sharing one last drink you headed back into the locker room to get changed.

After getting dressed you then head back to your manor house and enjoy a modest supper before going to bed. Tomorrow was going to be a big day for sure... one way or another...

How should you prepare?

You figured it would be best to do the whole pick up and transport in stealth to make sure the girl stayed safe, a convoy of yakuza would be too much of a red flag and attract way too much attention. If you had some of your boys as backup and were careful things should go pretty smoothly.

After selecting one of your more elegant and fashionable suits you head off to the bathroom for a quick shave and make sure you look presentable. You'd only have one chance at a first impression with these guys and you knew how important appearances were in situations like this. Getting the job done was only half the mission, if you didn't impress your new associates they might turn to someone else. That wouldn't be good.

"Here goes nothing..." you whisper confidently to yourself as you head out to meet the limo that pulled up to greet you. "Hey Mike, get in and let's head out, don't want to keep the princess waiting for her carriage." the driver said with a smile as he rolled down the window to wave. You grinned as you leaned down to greet your friend. "Hey Sai, are the others ready? They'll be expecting us in just a few more hours and I'd like to arrive early."

Sai nodded and unlocked the back doors on the limo. "Yep, they'll be meeting us there. As soon as you get in we'll be ready to go." he replied as you open the door and climb in. "Good work, Sai. You did have time to outfit this ride like I asked, right?" you inquire as you stretch out your feet and relax a bit. "Bulletproof glass windows, reinforced frame, upgraded engine... everything you told me to. Just wait til' our girl sees her escort for the day." Sai replied as he tapped the windshield.

You both share a laugh as you set out for the airport to meet your new business partners. Sai turns on the radio and begins singing along to a new pop song that just got released as you look out at the scenery passing by just outside the window. You thought about what your boss Ryu had told you about the night before and carefully thought about what you'd do once you meet up with the girl.

You had been in Japan long enough to pick up on the culture and rules of being a yakuza, but triads were something you had little to no experience with. Would they be more like the SGY with an honor code and morals... or more like the mafia you left back in America, ruthless and fearsome? Maybe a bit of both? Whatever the case you'd have to be careful how you played your cards if you want to make some new friends instead of enemies.

As the limo pulled into the airport you straightened your tie and made sure everything in the limo was ready for your guests. "Alright Sai, drop me off and get ready to pull back around when I come out with our new associates. We'll give em' the five star treatment and show them they made the right choice in trusting us." you instruct as Sai pulls up to the front sidewalk and comes to a stop. "Sounds good, I'll be waiting. Don't take too long." Sai replied as he drove off and you turned to face the front doors.

"Here we go." you say with a sly smile as you walk into the main lobby. "Hope you guys are ready."

"Hello sir, thank you for being patient. How may I assist you today?" You give her a smile and compliment her hair as you tell her about your friends flight arriving soon. "Oh yes, a group of gentlemen in suits and sunglasses asked about that flight too. I believe it docked just a minute or so ago." she replies as you turn towards the terminal and whisper a curse under your breath.

You couldn't run or do anything to raise suspicion, you just had to hope that you could find her before any rival triads or thugs do. As you approach the main gate you notice a group of men in suits arguing over which way they should go to find the correct arriving flight. "I think my luck just changed for the better." you whisper as you head over to greet them.

"Excuse me, gents. I overheard you debating over the arrival of a flight." you say casually as you give them a friendly smile and wave as you approach. "I believe the flight you are looking for arrives on the other side of the main lobby near the northeastern gate. Better hurry, it docks in just a few minutes." The men take turns looking at each before one of them mutters a quick word of thanks as they rush off towards the direction you just came from. Looks like they bought your lie.
