144.content:
You were relaxing in your outdoor hot tub with a new admirer you had bumped into on your way back to your private manor house. She was a tourist visiting from Europe, a college aged woman in her mid twenties who ran into you on her way out of the Sakura Resort courtyard. You had been in a hurry to deposit the spoils of a recent job into your safe, but you somehow always managed to find some time for the ladies. The fact that she looked like she just walked out of a playboy shoot didn't hurt either.

"So, you own this place?" she asked as she snuggled up to you in her tight string bikini while you poured yourself a glass of scotch. "Yep, well not entirely, I must confess. I run the place but I work for a guy who keeps the lights on and the springs steamy." you reply as the woman laughed and admired the view from your upper deck. "He must work you pretty hard if he trusts you to take care of a beautiful place like this." she says with a smile.

You let out a chuckle as you remembered your first introduction to your new boss during a meeting between the yakuza and the american mob. "You don't know the half of it." you laugh as you take a sip of your drink. "He's definitely a good guy though. I'm glad I work for him, though some of his other employees are a real pain in the ass." The woman chuckles and leans in for a kiss when your cell phone rings from the nearby table.

With a sigh you get out of the water and dry off your hand before flipping the phone open and checking the I.D. Sure enough, it was your boss sending you a lead about a new job opportunity with a juicy payday. You sighed again as the woman crossed her arms and took a sip of your scotch. "It's about work, isn't it?" she asked in an annoyed tone. You nodded your head and began drying off. "Sorry, you know how it is. Boss man cracks the whip and I gotta get my ass in gear. We got a surprise contract and I need to head into the office."

The woman frowned for a moment before giving you a resigned smile. "Yeah, I know how it is. Bosses can be real jerks sometimes." She sighs as you head inside the house to get dressed. "Do you want my number so we can continue this little date sometime or should I just head out too?" she asks as she leans back in the tub to take in the view of the mountains. "How's the day after tomorrow sound? I should be free this weekend." you call out as you pick a suit from your closet.

The woman rolls her eyes and grins as she takes another sip of your scotch. "Sure, I'm in town until next week. How's eight sound?" she calls from outside as you head back over to say goodbye. "It's a date honey, see you then." you reply as you give her a light kiss on the cheek and take a quick swig out of your bottle of scotch. "Feel free to stay here as long as you like and help yourself to anything in the kitchen. Security will see you out when you're ready to go."

The woman thanks you for being such a gentleman and goes back to relaxing while you head downstairs to meet up with your driver. This job was big, a whole shipment of goods would be arriving in the harbor tomorrow and if you planned this out right you could walk away with a literal kings ransom. You climbed into a limo as the boss called up again to discuss the details of the job. Apparently, the boat was set to arrive at the docks in the early hours of the morning with a crew of armed guards and possibly other security.

As you talked you slowly began to formulate a plan of action...
144.title: Business Call

choices: Take the deal
Try to lower the price a little
Walk away
145.content:
You sigh to yourself as you walk through Tokyo's red light district in search of employees for your boss' newest enterprise: a fancy love hotel. Ryu had gotten the place off of a man who loved to gamble who came up short with his more recent payments and had the bright idea to hire actual prostitutes to get an advantage over the competition in the area. Unfortunately, this job was proving to be a bit harder than you originally anticipated.

You had been to five separate brothels, all of which had reasonably cute girls, but they were all either uninterested in working for a yakuza or simply not up to the standards your boss had laid out for you. They had to be clean, no STDs, no addictions and had to pass a high standard of beauty. You had also been instructed to keep an eye out for girls who could tend to... particular requests from high profile customers. That would be fun.

You hated the idea of returning to the boss empty handed and telling him you failed, but at this rate you'd be out here for weeks without landing a single new hire. You chuckle to yourself as you walk into yet another brothel and are greeted by women in bikinis. "The boss always did have high standards, but even I'm not this picky..." You ask the women a few questions as they give you a lap dance and offer them the job.

"Sorry, I already agreed to work here for the next year or so, my boss would destroy my reputation if I went back on our deal." one of the girls replied with a regretful smile. "Same for most of the rest of us, we earn good money and can't afford to jeopardize it." You rub your forehead as you hand them each a ten thousand yen note and thank them for their time. This was getting pretty frustrating. With a brief yawn you decide to take a quick break and head over to a nearby bar.

"Just a bottle of good sake, please." you call over to the bartender as she wipes a glass. "Right away, sir!" comes the cheerful reply. You light up a cigar and put another ten thousand yen note on the table while the bartender gets your drink. "Drowning your sorrows, sir? We have some stronger stuff if you'd like?" she asks as she puts the bottle and a glass in front of you. A laugh escapes your lips as you exhale a cloud of smoke and begin pouring your drink.

"No, ha, nothing like that... I'm just having a hard time finding suitable clients for my boss. He needs me to find some workers and I haven't had any luck all night, just thought I'd take a break." you reply with a smile. The woman quickly looks around to make sure no one else can hear her before leaning in. "You don't need... sex workers, do you?" she whispers in a hushed tone. This gets your attention and you nod your head as you exhale a puff of smoke. "Yeah, I guess so." you whisper back.

"For 100,000 yen I might be able to set you up with a guy who can find what you need. All his girls and guys are clean, no diseases, no human trafficking and no sexual hang ups. What do you say?" she offers. You take a deep breath and down a large sip of your drink. "What's the catch? You're asking a lot of money for some guy I've never even met." you finally reply as the bartender writes down an address on a napkin.

"I know it's risky, but 100,000 yen is half of what I normally charge for his address. His workers won't come cheap, but you won't find better anywhere in Japan. I'm offering this price because I know you can afford it and you'll provide me and my boss lots of money. If I'm lying... hey, it's only 100,000 yen, or you can go back to skimming the local brothels for amateurs, your call handsome." She then folds the napkin up and holds it out to you.

You take another sip of your drink as you think over her offer. You didn't have much money to spare and she was asking for a pretty huge amount... but the idea of going back out there and spending the rest of the night going to various sex clubs wasn't very appealing either...
145.title: Talent Scout

choices: Head straight to the address
Call your boss and try to get some more assistance
Call your yakuza buddies and see if they want to help you
1452.content:
"How about you lower the price to 50,000 yen?" you ask as you take another sip of your drink. The woman frowns and withdraws the napkin from your reach. "Sorry, honey. If you're that broke I doubt you'd be able to afford anything my boss is offering. Maybe come back when you got more cash." she replies as she pours herself a glass of sake from your bottle. "The offer is on the table."

You groan as you count up how much cash you had on you at the moment. You could definitely afford the price, though it wouldn't leave you anywhere near enough to keep searching brothels and clubs and there was no way you were bringing any of your own money into this. "Look, it's not that I can't pay... I just don't have enough on me at the moment." you reply with a smile. "How about 75,000 or maybe 80,000? I can afford that."

The woman merely shakes her head and stuffs the napkin into her cleavage. "I'm already giving you a discount at 100,000 yen, I can't go lower than that. However, I do have a task I could use some help with. I've set aside about 45,000 yen as a reward that I can pay from my personal fund. Do the job and I'll knock the price down to an even 50,000 yen, sound good?"

You sigh and take a long drag off your cigar as you consider your options. You didn't like the idea of running errands for someone you just met, but the thought of going on an endless slog through Tokyo's red light district wasn't very appealing either. You had already been to several places already and none of them stacked up to Ryu's demanding specifications. This bartender and her boss might be your only shot.

"Alright, I've got some free time. Tell me a little more about the job and maybe I'll take care of it for you." you reply as you stub out your cigar and finish off your drink. "If you're only offering 50,000 yen as a reward it can't be too hard." The bartender smiles as she leans over the counter and takes a sip of her drink. "Alright then, I actually think you might be perfect for this job, but we'll see, won't we?"

You pour yourself a fresh drink and listen to her story. "Let's see, when did this all start..." she began as she rubbed her chin. "I think it was about three or four months back. These prostitutes started robbing gullible customers all around the red light district. They'd promise them a good time and then steal all of their money and valuables once their clothes were off. These chicks are most likely part of a gang, they're all pretty tough and have kicked the shit out of anyone who tried to fight back."

You swallow a large gulp of your drink as you listen to her continue. This was getting interesting. "At first nobody really minded since most of the victims where drunks and losers, in fact some of us bartenders actually made a bit of extra profit from guys who wanted to drown their sorrows. That only lasted a few weeks though, and now me and several of my friends are losing profits because fewer and fewer people come around here for fear of getting robbed. No one has died or anything, but people are still worried about losing all their stuff to these gals."

"I see." you say with a light chuckle. "Like you said, these ladies are probably either part of a gang or working for someone else. No way ordinary sex workers would be able to pull something like this off." The bartender nods her head as she finishes off her drink and lets out a sigh. "Probably, the cops either don't care or were bought off, I doubt they'd take this long to deal with the problem if they were really trying, something's up."

"I think I can do this. Find the girls, get them to stop what they're doing and maybe find out who's behind this in the first place." you reply with a grin. "It's a deal. Just tell me where to start." The bartender breathes a sigh of relief and writes down a new address on a napkin and hands it to you. "Thanks, I was honestly worried about this problem getting out of hand. Here's the address of one of their more recent victims, poor bastard lost his wife's wedding ring and half the price of a new car. He'll help you get started."

You grab the napkin and check the address, which was thankfully close by. "Alright then, I think I'll head out. Thanks for the info." you say as you get up to leave. "Good luck, if you need any further help I'll be here all night." the bartender replies with a wave. In just a few minutes you were back out in the crowded streets as a light rain began to fall. Time to make your first move...
1452.title: Stolen Dignity

choices: Burn It Down
Every Mushroom Cloud Has A Silver Lining
Absence Of Evidence
Bombs On A Plane
Air, Ground And All Around
15.content:
Name: Samantha Chang

Age: 19

Sex: Female

Race: Asian (50%) Caucasian (50%)

Height: 5'7

Appearance: Skinny and lightly muscular, but fairly strong and agile. She has short black hair, pale skin and smokey grey eyes. She favors simple clothing such as tank tops, track pants, jeans and plain shirts and dislikes makeup. Her arms and part of her torso are decorated with extensive and intricate tattoos detailing her past, family ties and love of explosives. She tends to wear light jewelry such as earrings and necklaces from time to time as well.

Home Base: Crown Castle, a large abandoned military base high atop a remove cliff in rural Australia. The base isn't much to look at but makes an excellent place to field test new explosives and gadgets. Outside the ruins of the base is a large three story house where Samantha lives at. The place is stocked with all manor of modern luxuries such as a large flatscreen in the living room and a botanical garden on the upper balcony. It also has a large basement equipped with a panic room and armory. Lastly, there is a staff of six butlers, six maids, two chefs, two repairmen and two mechanics who maintain everything. These servants are all trained in self defense and and have their own private quarters outside the main house.

Skills/Perks: A master of everything explosive, be it cherry bombs or warheads. Samantha has dedicated her life to researching newer and better ways to make things go boom. It addition to knowing how to make bombs she has the knowledge to disarm or delay them as well. Somewhat unexpectedly she also has an interest in botanical research and is often found experimenting on plants. Through much research and hard work she has uncovered many new types of organic weaponry, such as nonlethal grenades infused with plant extracts that can paralyze anyone caught in the blast or infused plant matter bombs that create a bigger boom through a unique blend of chemicals.

Weaknesses: She's a bit of a one trick pony compared to the other mercenary's, even if it's a really good trick. Almost all of her combat related skills involves explosives in some way, which makes her less versatile compared to the others. She knows how to shoot different types of guns and has learned some martial arts, but both skill sets are no where near the level of professionals. She does have a knack for using sniper rifles, but its the only type of gun she has any real skill with.

Starting Assets: An advanced bomb suit made to resist extreme heat, shrapnel, radiation and forceful impacts which renders low grade explosives useless and greatly weakens stronger ones. (The suit is very heavy though, and hinders movement when worn.) A large laboratory filled with chemicals and supplies to make homemade bombs and other useful things, such as explosive ammo or high yield blasting clay. A garage stocked with two high performance sports cars and a motorcycle and a helipad for quick extraction. A hidden private jet about two miles away from the main house for stealthy escapes. Finally, a massive explosives storeroom stocked with everything from frag grenades and C4 to thermite and fireworks.

Starting Contracts

Burn It Down - A rich man who lost most of his fortune to his cheating ex-wife and her lawyer boyfriend wants revenge, plain and simple. He is willing to pay most of his remaining savings to anyone who can infiltrate his old manor house on the edge of Sydney and burn it to the ground. Smash the vases, tear the paintings, burn the rugs and blow up the car collection. He wants his wife and her lover ruined for what they did to him and intends to make them suffer. While he won't mind if they are killed in the chaos he has put aside an extra sum of cash if they make it though the destruction alive. Pay: $3,000,000 - $5,000,000

Every Mushroom Cloud Has A Silver Lining - A terrorist group has recently come into a nuclear warhead that they managed to purchase off the black market and are transporting it past the coast of japan. An unidentified government official would like it if some freelance mercenaries could acquire the warhead for him without any other nations finding out about it. This job will be fairly risky since the terrorists are moderately well armed and unpredictable. Ultimately, completion of this contract will come down to a hard choice... do you hand over a nuke to a shady government agent for a massive payday, dispose of it... or keep it for yourself? Pay: $1,000,000 - $250,000,000

Absence Of Evidence - A criminal and his gang have recently been arrested in one of the biggest busts in recent memory. Drug running, arms trafficking and even assassinations... these guys are going away for a long time if the evidence taken from their hideout makes it to court. Luckily for them a dirty cop on the inside accepted a payoff to put out their contract for you to find. The job is simple: destroy the evidence room at the police H.Q. before it can be transported to a more secure location. The guy doesn't care how this gets done or who gets in the way, the evidence has to be disposed of in its entirety. Your call how much innocent blood you want to spill to make this happen. Pay: $5,000,000 - $10,000,000

Bombs On A Plane - Some rich businessman has landed in some hot water after a controversial decision he made cost his company over half of their yearly profits. Rather than outright fire him someone has rigged his personal private jet with explosives that are set to detonate if the plane either shuts off or goes below a certain altitude. The businessman has refused to contact the police and insists that his jet must be saved at all costs. Fortunately, the plane had just refueled before takeoff and will pass over Australia within the hour. If you hurry you can probably make contact before anyone gets hurt. The businessman has already promised a hefty reward for anyone who saves him, which he'll happily increase if they can also save his beloved jet. Pay: $50,000,000 - $100,000,000

Air, Ground And All Around - A wealthy scientist needs volunteers to test her new missile defense system to see how it stacks up to the competition. Sadly, her reputation for playing with unstable compounds and causing disastrous side effects has driven off most potential assistants. If someone could help her get the kinks out of her new toy she'd probably offer them a hefty reward... and maybe even give them a prototype for themselves. Pay: $30,000,000 - $50,000,000
15.title: The Mad Bomber

choices: Sneak in, plant bombs and leave before the heat shows up
Airdrop in and unleash hell on everything
Cause a distraction, bust through the front gate and storm the house with backup
151.content:
You were relaxing and sipping on a Pina Colada as you channel surfed and checked your email for updates on potential job contracts. After an early morning testing out explosives you were happy to have some time to yourself but didn't want to waste the whole day without getting some progress towards clearing your debt. You still couldn't believe that you'd have to come up with a billion dollars, and soon... unless you wanted trouble.

After a few minutes of catching up on current events you noticed a potentially lucrative contract from a man who wanted revenge on his ex and her lover. Turns out they both screwed him out of nearly his entire fortune, including his house and most of his possessions. Now he wants it all destroyed and is willing to pay out what he has left to anyone who can make it happen. The only requirement is the complete destruction of the property and all assets contained within... the furniture, the cars, the silverware, the electronics, the windows, the kitchen sink... everything.

You grinned as you read over the details and finished off your drink. The money was a bit lower than what you would have liked but its not every day you get to destroy an entire mansion filled with valuables. The guy even offered to throw in some extra green if you allowed the cheating wife and her new husband to live and experience the pain of losing everything. It was pretty vicious, but you were already struggling to decide what toys to bring with you on your trip to Sydney.

You texted a quick confirmation to the man that you had accepted the contract and would be heading out within the hour. After he replied back with the address you head over to your armory to gear up and prepare. This would be a loud job no doubt, which means cops and maybe other forms of security would be an obstacle. After a few minutes of careful thinking you decided on a plan...
151.title: Homewrecker

choices: Head in through the back door
Sneak in through the upstairs window
Move around the garden and enter through the garage
1511.content:
As much as you wanted to go in guns blazing and as much as the job begged for a disproportionate amount of destruction you knew the safe and sane option was probably the best course of action. If you went in raising seven flavors of hell the cops and maybe even the SWAT team would be on the scene in no time. Nothing you couldn't handle, but a real pain in the ass to deal with. Instead it would be better to do this covertly, at least at first.

You pack up some thermite, C4 plastic explosives, a remote detonator, a revolver and a compact SMG and change into some more appropriate clothing. With your light combat armor you'd have the freedom to move around quickly and silently while also being protected from low grade firearms and explosives. It wouldn't save you from a big explosion or sniper rounds, but it would keep you protected from minor annoyances.

Once you had everything ready you headed out to meet your pilot and planned a course of action. You would infiltrate the grounds stealthily and plant some remote charges on important structural columns around the main property. Once you were clear you would then detonate the explosives and level the entire house in one go. The plan was foolproof but required some careful timing if you wanted to avoid dealing with law enforcement.

You arrive in Sydney with about an hour of daylight left and check into a hotel for the evening. Tomorrow you would put your plan into action and make your escape before anyone knew what was going on. All that remained for tonight was a good amount of sleep and a big paycheck once your contract was completed. You quickly doze off dreaming of dollar signs and burning manor houses as the night stretches on.

By the next morning you feel completely refreshed and ready to get to work. After checking out of your hotel you make your way to the address you had been given and scope the place out from across the street. The whole property was big and extravagant as you had expected, with a massive front yard lined with gardens and fountains. It was so beautiful it made you all the more eager to blow it to kingdom come.

You sneak past the guards standing near the driveway with ease and quickly move around to the back of the house. An oblivious guard walks right past you as he heads over to water the flowers and you make your way to the back door. Your first instinct was to head inside through the ground floor but after taking a closer look at your surroundings a few other ideas came to mind. After taking a moment to consider your options you quickly moved on to the next phase of your infiltration....
1511.title: Infiltration

choices: Continue with your main job for now
Try to break into the safe room
Call in some assistance
15112.content:
With a deep breath you hop up onto the ground floor window and use it to grab a thin section of the outer wall that let you climb up to the upstairs balcony. You then pull yourself over the rail as the guard below heads back inside after watering the flowers, luckily he didn't spot you sneak in through the open door. Once you make it inside the bedroom you take a quick look around to make sure you're alone and notice a lot of valuables lying around the room.

"I don't have any room for paintings or furniture... but there are probably a few trinkets I can grab for some extra cash." you think to yourself as you head over to a cabinet in the corner of the room and begin searching it for valuables. Aside from some fine porcelain and other fragile junk you found nothing worth taking so you moved on to a large ornately decorated chest at the foot of the bed and used a bit of thermite to burn through the lock.

You pop the chest open and discover several jewelry boxes, expensive knick knacks and a few locked cases. After spending a good ten minutes looting everything you had room for you were ready to head out and get on with the job. Along with some necklaces, rings and cold hard cash you had found a rare coin collection that would draw in a huge sum if you could find a proper fence to take it off your hands.

You wait for a guard making his rounds to pass by the upstairs door and slowly move out into the upstairs hallway when you hear his footsteps trail off in another direction. "Looks like its clear, time to get to work!" you smile cheerfully as you withdraw a C4 charge from your explosives bag and attach it to the back of a statue where it wouldn't be spotted."One down, about a dozen to go."

You carefully creep down the hallway and locate a sturdy looking support structure near an alcove filled with pottery and modern art. "I hate to be a critic, but these works would look a look better burnt to embers in a giant ash heap." you joke as you rig up a few thermite charges and place another C4 package on the back of the support structure. "When this bad boy goes off everything in this area will be incinerated. It's a shame I can't take any of it with me but the pay I'm expecting for this job will be a nice compensation."

You carefully move around the upper floors and duck past a few more patrolling guards as you finish getting things set up. Once half of your explosives were set up you headed for the staircase to finish up with the ground floor when you come across two security guards talking while sitting on a sofa near the guest room. As you listen in you hear them talk about some valuables being moved into a safe room somewhere on the basement level of the house.

As the two get up to resume their duties you pause to think about your next move. Hitting the safe room would take a lot of time and would probably use up a lot of your remaining equipment, but there was definitely some real nice stuff locked up in there. You check your supplies and see that aside from a few more C4 charges all you had left was some spare thermite. Was it worth the risk? Or was finishing your main job more important?

You could always call in some support to deliver some supplies or back up, but that tended to get expensive and you would have to pay for the help whether you got into the room or not. What's your next move?
15112.title: Extra Loot

choices: Sneak inside and burn the room with thermite charges
Go in the front and make a beeline for the room
Cause a distraction and try to locate the room quickly
153.content:
You carefully monitored the police HQ from the room of your twentieth story apartment and watched as cops and civilians went in and out of its doors. There seemed to be three main entrances, the two front doors near the sidewalk in front of the building, the rear entrance facing the main parking lot and a small side door that was likely intended for janitors or other workers. Getting inside wouldn't be too hard, but the fact that you had no idea where the evidence room was posed a small problem.

The building wasn't really huge, but still big enough that it would likely take some searching to find where you needed to go. That would make a stealth approach pretty hard if you didn't carefully plan ahead but just going in guns blazing would attract a lot of attention and make it a chore just to get close to the evidence room. You sigh and step away from the window as you try to think. You didn't bring many supplies with you since this was such a small job but you wonder if maybe you should contact someone to help you out.

The pay for this job wasn't bad but it wasn't really great either and it would be a pain to share a cut of it with someone else. You pull up a chair as you unzip the duffel bag on the table and began rummaging through its contents. You had brought most of the supplies you need for small explosives and utilities along with a pair of 9mm handguns and a grenade pistol you had developed. The thing would be hard to conceal and only held a single round but it made up for it by being quick to reload and being able to blow a door clean off its hinges.

"Maybe I should have brought something a bit higher tech?" you muse to yourself as you take inventory of your ammo. "Nah, the big stuff is too expensive for a job like this. I'll just have to be careful how I plan this out." You got up and grabbed a cold soda out of the fridge as you came up with an idea that would help you clear the evidence locker. Once you were done you hide the 9mm handguns under your clothes and slip the grenade pistol into a large purse you had brought along.

You also take the supplies you would need from the duffel bag and then draw up a quick plan of escape once your mission was complete. Once everything was ready you head downstairs and hop onto the motorcycle you had rented for this job and drive over to the police HQ. Now that you were here you'd just have to put your plan into action...
153.title: Limited Options

choices: Pack for complete bomb disposal and light combat
Pack for heavy combat and light bomb disposal
Pack for a balance of bomb disposal and combat
154.content:
You were busy tinkering on a new explosive project when you received an urgent notice from one of your butlers about a potential client offering some big money on a contract that required immediate action. With a smile you thanked the butler and answered the cellphone he handed you.

The man on the other end was a panicked mess who stuttered and gasped at nearly every other word out of his mouth. He was a well-connected business man who had apparently stepped on the wrong toes somewhere down the line and was now facing a deadly bomb attached to his private jet. His assistants had zero luck disarming it and calling the authorities wasn't possible for whatever reason. That's where you come in.

The guy wanted you to fly out and save him, along with his cargo and his plane if at all possible. Apparently, he had something very valuable on board that he couldn't stand to part with and wants saved at all costs. In exchange, he's offering a massive reward for his safe rescue and the salvation of his personal jet by any means necessary. It would be a pretty tough job and time was definitely a factor... but the cash would be well worth the hassle.

You listen intently as the man gives you as much information about his situation as he can. He was now passing over Australia and would be flying through a nearby region within an hour or so. If the fuel held out you would have roughly five to six hours to save the businessman, disarm or remove the bomb and hopefully save the plane. Challenging, certainly, but not impossible, especially for someone with your skill set.

"I'll begin preparing immediately." you reply as you put away your tools. "Tell your pilot to stay on course, I'll intercept and see what I can do. See you within the hour." With that you hung up just as the businessman blurted out a quick "THANK YOU!" on the other end. With a sigh you head outside to the airfield and tell your pilot to be ready to move as soon as you returned with your gear.

He nodded in confirmation and lit up a cigarette as he began checking to make sure the aircraft was ready to fly. The thing was an old refurbished fighter from WWII when it was first put into action but your talented mechanics had made sure it stayed competitive and up to date in today's modern world. It wasn't the fastest thing in the sky but it was extremely well-rounded and could get the job done.

After changing out of your work clothes you began gearing up to be ready to move as soon as possible. Normally, you liked to do a bit of planning before taking a job, but time wasn't on your side right now. You'd have to quickly and carefully choose your gear and then head out. Risks and many variables still remained unknown, though hostiles and other threats seemed likely. What kind of approach should you take?
154.title: Gearing Up For The Danger Zone

choices: "Fly up alongside it as it passes."
"Fly above it straight ahead."
"Dip under it as it flies overhead."
1543.content:
You had no idea what you were about to face or what kind of explosives you were up against so you decided to balance your gear to reflect that. You couldn't bring all of your tools or any heavy guns but a balanced selection of equipment meant you could deal with any complications that popped up. After changing into a specialized wingsuit and packing up your supplies you headed back out to greet the pilot.

"According to the clock we have about 45 minutes to intercept this guy and secure his plane!" you shout at at the pilot as he hops into the cockpit of his tiny fighter. "Get us up in the air, we'll only have one shot at this and I don't want to miss it. I've got the coordinates and other stuff, but we need to get moving." The pilot nods his head as he fires up the propeller and begins cruising down the runway. "Aye-aye, captain."

You soar off into the sky and marvel at the beauty of the surrounding landscape from the passenger seat of the small but smooth flying WWII fighter. As you flew off towards the point of interception you began to carefully formulate a plan of action. It sucks that you didn't have more time but half an hour or so should be good enough to pull this job off. The hardest part would be right at the start... if you could get past that you'd be all set.

There was no time to do this safely, you'd only have one way to securely enter the plane without risking setting off the bomb. If the doors of the plane connect to a fail safe then opening the door would only cause a premature detonation. Instead you'd have to deploy your wingsuit as the plane approached, snag it with a special heavy duty grappling device, cut open a small hole in the exterior of the body, slip inside and then seal the hole back up. You'd have to do all of this in a time frame of about 30-40 seconds. Not exactly easy.

As you arrive over the tiny town where the plane was due to pass you had the pilot survey the area for anything that could affect the mission. After flying in a few circles you breathed a small sigh of relief that no enemy aircraft or ground troops were spotted. The last thing you needed right now was a bunch of guys shooting at you while you tried to jump from plane to plane thousands of feet above the ground.

Soon enough your pilot caught sight of an approaching aircraft flying in from the northeast. That was definitely your target! "Right on time." you grinned as you prepared yourself for the jump. No way was this going to be easy, even for a professional like yourself. Time to give your pilot his final order as he gets in range...
1543.title: Up In The Air

info.brief_description: Become a soldier of fortune seeking to repay a debt and earn some blood money on the side.
info.description:
You have a debt to repay. One billion dollars. There is a price on your head until you can earn the cash to pay off the corrupt government that loaned you the money to get started in this business. You are a mercenary, a soldier of fortune who earns vast wealth by taking contracts from shady and influential people. Theft, vandalism, kidnapping, smuggling, destruction and even assassination are all on the table for the right price. Will you be a knight in shining armor cleaning up the messes left by weaker warriors or a heartless killer who only cares about the cash for a job well done? The choice is yours, but one thing about you is certain... you are a professional. Time to get paid.

Rules

1. Adult content is fine, but don't get too extreme. This is an action adventure style of story, not an erotica or stand up comedy routine. Don't go absolutely crazy with the sex scenes and jokes. Heavy amounts of cursing and some moderately descriptive sexual content is okay. Don't add anything you wouldn't see in an R rated movie. Comedic characters are allowed but most people should be fairly serious.

2. You are free to come up with your own story and customize the characters a bit, but don't change their personality. All of the mercenaries are flexible, but also have their own strengths and weaknesses. A stealth expert character doesn't have to always use stealth for example, but their first thought shouldn't be to go in guns blazing and screaming.

3. Keep things fairly realistic. Mild sci-fi elements like satellite orbital guns and VTOLs are fine but nothing like aliens or superpowers. I'll also allow minor cybernetics like artificial limbs and eyes, but not giant mechs or super advanced power armor. (If you wouldn't see it in Deus Ex or Payday 2 don't add it here.)

4. Violence, gore and torture is fine, but try to keep it realistic. People shouldn't explode into chunks from anything less than bombs or rockets. Exploding heads and severed limbs are fine if the caliber of bullet or weapon is high enough though.

5. As a soldier of fortune you are expected to gain vast amounts of wealth and equipment, but keep things within reason and try to pace yourself with the story. Remember that most of your cash should go in storage to pay back your loan. With that said, you are allowed to spend some of the money you get on things like new properties, hideouts, vehicles and new gadgets and weapons. Just don't go giving yourself a private island and aircraft carrier during the first few chapters. This interactive is about rising to the top, not starting there.

6. After completing a contract the mercenary returns to their base to store however much cash they got and plan a new contract. As such, make sure you keep the amount of stored cash updated upon each return. The goal is to eventually reach 1 billion ($1,000,000,000) dollars, which enables the character to conclude their story. Always make sure the amount of cash earned is proportional to the difficulty of the contract and how well the character completed their objectives. Don't rush to the end either, try to keeps things going for at least 50-75 chapters before concluding things. Individual contracts can last as long as you like.

7. I Have made a new interactive for all reader created characters, please use it if you have an idea for an original merc. Thank you.

https://www.writing.com/main/interact/item_id/1947792-Mercenary-New-Roads

8. Have fun, killer.
